Comedy.description: After heroically defeating both the Snow Queen and the Snow King, Gerda, a selfless adventurer, is struggling with the disappearance of her parents. In order to find them, Gerda and her friends go on a dangerous mission.

Comedy.title: So This Is Christmas
Comedy.description: Eighteen-year-old Ashley's life is headed in the wrong direction. She's been hanging out with a bad crowd and seeking an escape from the drama at home.

Comedy.title: Some Kind of Wonderful
Comedy.description: A young tomboy, Watts (Mary Stuart Masterson), discovers that her feelings for her best friend, Keith (Eric Stoltz), run deeper than just friendship when he gets a date with Amanda (Lea Thompson), the most popular girl in school. Amanda's ex, Hardy (Craig Scheffer), who is from the rich section of town, is unable to let go of her, and plans to get back at Keith.

Comedy.title: Someone Else
Comedy.description: David constantly stresses over his love life and feels a choice must be made, stay with his too-agreeable girlfriend, Lisa, or go after exciting and tricky Nina.

Comedy.title: Sorry to Bother You
Comedy.description: In an alternate present-day version of Oakland, telemarketer Cassius Green discovers a magical key to professional success, propelling him into a macabre universe.

Comedy.title: Splitting Adam
Comedy.description: After stumbling across a cloning machine, Adam Baker creates multiple versions of himself and finds the answer to handling his many summer responsibilities! Rating: TV-G

Comedy.title: The Spy Next Door
Comedy.description: Jackie Chan is a former superspy who wants to settle down with his girlfriend, but first has to battle Russian terrorists.

Comedy.title: The Spy Who Dumped Me
Comedy.description: After being dumped by her boyfriend who is a spy, a woman and her friend become embroiled in a conspiracy.

Comedy.title: The Square
Comedy.description: Christian is the respected curator of a contemporary art museum, a divorced but devoted father of two who drives an electric car and supports good causes. His next show is “The Square”, an installation which invites passersby to altruism, reminding them of their role as responsible fellow human beings. But sometimes, it is difficult to live up to your own ideals: Christian’s foolish response to the theft of his phone drags him into shameful situations. Meanwhile, the museum's PR agency has created an unexpected campaign for “The Square”. The response is overblown and sends Christian, as well as the museum, into an existential crisis.

Comedy.title: Status Update
Comedy.description: A teenager discovers a magical app that makes his social media updates come true.

Comedy.title: Stella's Last Weekend
Comedy.description: Brothers Jack (Nat Wolff) and Oliver (Alex Wolff) reunite to put their beloved dog to sleep. While their zany mother plans a party to celebrate Stella’s life, things go hilariously awry when the brothers discover they love the same girl.

Comedy.title: Step Dogs
Comedy.description: Two very different dogs move into together when their owners get married. But when thieves try to break into their house, these four-legged foes must team up to defend their home.

Comedy.title: Still Smokin
Comedy.description: In this fourth Cheech and Chong adventure, the duo's view of humor, drugs, and sex are let loose in Amsterdam. Still Smokin' finds the two comedians arriving in the Netherlandish capital to go the city's first film festival.

Comedy.title: Stung
Comedy.description: A swanky garden party turns into a nightmare when giant killer wasps attack in this blood-splattered horror comedy.

Comedy.title: Suburbicon
Comedy.description: From director George Clooney, the small idyllic town of Suburbicon is the perfect place for Gardner Lodge (Academy Award  winner Matt Damon) to make a home. But beneath this tranquil surface lies a disturbing reality, where nothing is as it seems.

Comedy.title: Super
Comedy.description: When sad-sack loser Frank (Rainn Wilson) sees his ex-addict wife (Liv Tyler) willingly snatched by a seductive drug dealer (Kevin Bacon), he finds himself bereft and wholly unable to cope. But soon he decides to fight back under the guise of a DIY superhero called Crimson Bolt. With a hand-made suit, a wrench, and a crazed sidekick named Boltie (Ellen Page), the Crimson Bolt beats his way through the mean streets of crime in hopes of saving his wife.  The rules were written a long time ago: You are not supposed to molest children, cut lines or key cars; if you do, prepare to face the wrath of the Crimson Bolt!

Comedy.title: Support the Girls
Comedy.description: Regina Hall (Girls Trip) stars as the hardworking manager of a "sports bar with curves" who runs the joint like a family, even as sketchy employees, bad customers and an even worse boss put her good nature to the test.

Comedy.title: The Sweet Life
Comedy.description: The classic story of “Boy Meets Girl” … until Girl convinces Boy to drive to San Francisco with her … so they can throw themselves off the Golden Gate Bridge.  Only they fall in love along the way.

Comedy.title: Swimming With Men
Comedy.description: It's sink or synchro for a ragtag group of middle-aged men chasing aquatic glory. The Trip series' Rob Brydon stars in this hilariously offbeat ode to following your calling.

Comedy.title: Swimming With Sharks
Comedy.description: A motion picture executive's assistant puts up with his abusive boss up to a point and then completely snaps, in this ultra-dark comedy from first-time director (and former Hollywood assistant) George Huang.

Comedy.title: Swindle
Comedy.description: Griffin Bing wants to swindle a swindler, right a wrong, take back property unethically obtained by deceptive means (whatever sounds fancier) and sets off to recruit the ultimate crew. He is owed favors all over school and it's time to call them in! Rating: TV-G

Comedy.title: Swingers
Comedy.description: Director Doug Liman's career-making look into the psyche of 20-something males stars Jon Favreau as a struggling comedian, whose pathetic love life prompts his Hollywood wannabe pals to pump up his nightlife and immerse him in cocktail culture.

Comedy.title: Switching Goals
Comedy.description: Mary-Kate and Ashley Olsen executive produce and star in the rousing comedy of two sisters who hatch the ultimate scheme to find out how their other half lives--by Switching Goals.

Comedy.title: Tangerine
Comedy.description: It's Christmas Eve in Tinseltown and Sin-Dee (newcomer Kitana Kiki Rodriguez) is back on the block. Upon hearing that her pimp boyfriend (James Ransone, STARLET, "Generation Kill") hasn't been faithful during the 28 days she was locked up, the working girl and her best friend, Alexandra (newcomer Mya Taylor), embark on a mission to get to the bottom of the scandalous rumor. Their rip-roaring odyssey leads them through various subcultures of Los Angeles, including an Armenian family dealing with their own repercussions of infidelity. Director Sean Baker’s prior films (STARLET, PRINCE OF BROADWAY) brought rich texture and intimate detail to worlds seldom seen on film. TANGERINE follows suit, bursting off the screen with energy and style. A decidedly modern Christmas tale told on the streets of L.A., TANGERINE defies expectation at every turn.

Comedy.title: This Beautiful Fantastic
Comedy.description: A contemporary fairy tale set against the backdrop of a London garden, its an unlikely friendship between a reclusive young woman who dreams of writing children's books and a cranky widower.

Comedy.title: Time Freak
Comedy.description: Physics prodigy Stillman (Asa Butterfield) is destined for great things, only to be derailed when his girlfriend, Debbie (Sophie Turner) suddenly dumps him.

Comedy.title: Too Funny to Fail: The Life & Death of The Dana Carvey Show
Comedy.description: Why did "The Dana Carvey Show," with a writer’s room and cast including then unknowns Steve Carell, Stephen Colbert, Robert Smigel, and more, flop so spectacularly? "Too Funny to Fail" tells the true story of genius misfits who set out to make comedy history.

Comedy.title: Tragedy Girls
Comedy.description: Best friends Sadie and McKayla are on a mission to boost their social media fandom as amateur crime reporters hot on the trail of a deranged local serial killer. After they manage to capture the killer and secretly hold him hostage, they realize the best way to up get scoops on future victims would be to, you know, murder people themselves. As the @TragedyGirls become an overnight sensation and panic grips their small town, can their friendship survive the strain of national stardom? Will they get caught? Will their accounts get verified?

Comedy.title: The Treasure
Comedy.description: A hunt for buried treasure sends two men on a surprising comic caper in this Cannes prize-winning charmer.

Comedy.title: The Truth About Christmas
Comedy.description: An encounter with a Santa results in a drastic change.

Comedy.title: Two Family House
Comedy.description: Blue-collar Italian-American Buddy Visalo (Michael Rispoli) has a record of failed business ventures. After buying a rundown home, his new scheme is to transform the bottom floor into a neighborhood bar.

Comedy.title: Tyler Perry's Boo 2! A Madea Halloween
Comedy.description: Madea and friends scare up big laughs on a hell-arious journey to rescue her niece from a haunted campground in this screamingly funny follow-up to Tyler Perry's comedy hit.

Comedy.title: Tyrel
Comedy.description: Tyler (Jason Mitchell) is the lone black man on a weekend getaway with hard partying white strangers. As the testosterone and alcohol get out of hand, Tyler's trip begins to feel like a nightmare.

Comedy.title: UglyDolls
Comedy.description: An animated adventure in which the free-spirited UglyDolls confront what it means to be different, struggle with a desire to be loved, and ultimately discover who you truly are is what matters most.

Comedy.title: Under the Tree
Comedy.description: After moving back home, a man gets sucked into a dispute between his parents and their neighbors over an old and beautiful tree. What starts as a typical spat unexpectedly and violently reaches a boiling point, soon spiraling out of control.

Comedy.title: Under the Tuscan Sun
Comedy.description: A recently divorced San Francisco writer impulsively buys a villa during a trip to Italy and embarks on a life-changing adventure.

Comedy.title: Undrafted
Comedy.description: When twelve ragtag teammates set out to play what should be a meaningless summer intramural baseball game, it ends up becoming the most important game of their lives.

Comedy.title: The Unicorn
Comedy.description: An engaged couple, Caleb (Nick Rutherford) and Malory (Lauren Lapkus), set out on a wild night after discovering the secret to a happy marriage, but this experience inadvertently tests their relationship in ways they never imagined.

Comedy.title: Unmade Beds
Comedy.description: A London apartment becomes the center of sexual and reckless play for a group of twenty-somethings as they swap lovers and identities in search of their true selves.

Comedy.title: Up in the Air
Comedy.description: Ryan Bingham  is living the high life. Flying all over the world on business, he never stops moving...until he meets Alex, a fellow passenger and learns that life isn't about the journey, but the connections made along the way.

Comedy.title: Vampires
Comedy.description: A filmmaking crew attempts to document a real-life family of vampires, with bloody results.

Comedy.title: Vegas Vacation
Comedy.description: Vegas Vacation (1997) stars Chevy Chase and Beverly D'Angelo. Clark (Chevy Chase) and Ellen Griswold's (Beverly D'Angelo) disastrous family outing includes a visit with boorish Cousin Eddie (Randy Quaid).

Comedy.title: Venus in Fur
Comedy.description: Based on the Tony ® Award-winning Broadway play by David Ives, VENUS IN FUR is the latest film from master filmmaker Roman Polanski. Alone in a Paris theater after a long day of auditioning actresses for his new play, writer-director Thomas (Mathieu Amalric) complains that no actress he's seen has what it takes to play the lead female character: a woman who enters into an agreement with her male counterpart to dominate him as her slave. Thomas is about to leave the theater when actress Vanda (Emmanuelle Seigner) bursts in, a whirlwind of erratic - and, it turns out, erotic - energy. At first she seems to embody everything Thomas has been lamenting. She is pushy, foul-mouthed, desperate and ill-prepared - or so it seems. When Thomas finally, reluctantly, agrees to let her try out for the part, he is stunned and captivated by her transformation. Not only is Vanda a perfect fit (even sharing the character's name), but she apparently has researched the role exhaustively, learned her lines by heart and even bought her own props. The likeness proves to be much more than skin-deep. As the extended "audition" builds momentum, Thomas moves from attraction to obsession until, with Vanda taking an ever more dominant role, the balance of power shifts completely.

Comedy.title: Veronica Mars
Comedy.description: On the eve of her law-school graduation, Veronica turns amateur sleuth once again after ex-boyfriend, Logan, becomes a murder suspect.

Comedy.title: A Very Brady Christmas
Comedy.description: Deck the halls with love and laughter as the Brady Bunch comes home for Christmas! Mike, Carol and the whole gang are back, in a warm and wonderful two hour special featuring all of the characters from the popular series - plus their new families.

Comedy.title: A Very Sordid Wedding
Comedy.description: Seventeen years after family matriarch Peggy tripped over G.W.’s wooden legs in Sordid Lives, same-sex marriage equality has barreled into Winters, Texas and not everyone is ready to accept it. An anniversary memorial service is being planned in honor of Peggy at the bar while the Southside Baptist Church plans an "Anti-Equality" rally to protest the abomination of gay marriage and work to defend their religious freedom. The beloved cast of colorful characters are all on a collision course for shenanigans and fireworks on the big night. Along the way a bisexual serial killer shows up, a drag queen country medley is performed and a beauty-salon-versus-the-bigots battle turns getting your hair done into the front lines of the equality battle.  Friendships are tested and families are reunited as fear and bigotry are confronted with acceptance and understanding on the way to a surprise wedding with (almost) everyone in attendance.

Comedy.title: Vice
Comedy.description: The untold true story of Vice President Dick Cheney, a Washington insider who changed the course of history.

Comedy.title: Villains
Comedy.description: A pair of amateur criminals break into a suburban home and stumble upon a dark secret that two sadistic homeowners will do anything to keep from getting out.

Comedy.title: Waiting to Exhale
Comedy.description: Four successful African-American women endure the ups and downs of modern love in this witty, often hilarious film based on the best-selling novel by Terry McMillan.

Comedy.title: Wayne's World 2
Comedy.description: Wayne and Garth try to organize a marathon rock concert called Waynestock.

Comedy.title: We Have a Pope
Comedy.description: A comic and fictional exploration of the emotional struggles of a newly-elected pope coming to terms with the demands of his position.

Comedy.title: What Men Want
Comedy.description: A woman is boxed out by the male sports agents in her profession, but gains an unexpected edge over them when she develops the ability to hear their thoughts.

Comedy.title: When Harry Met Sally
Comedy.description: Can a man and a woman be friends, or does sex always get in the way? Meg Ryan and Billy Crystal star as two best friends of the opposite sex in this blockbuster, heartwarming romantic comedy.

Comedy.title: When Jeff Tried to Save the World
Comedy.description: When the manager of an old-school bowling alley discovers the owner's plans to sell, saving Winky's World means pulling himself out of the gutter, too.

Comedy.title: Where'd You Go, Bernadette
Comedy.description: Cate Blanchett stars as Bernadette, a loving mother and wife who embarks on journey to rediscover herself.

Comedy.title: White Night Wedding
Comedy.description: In this uproarious comedy, a middle-aged professor has some second thoughts about marrying a woman half his age.

Comedy.title: Wild Rose
Comedy.description: WILD ROSE tells the complicated story of musician Rose-Lynn, a woman from Scotland who is on a quest to become a country music star, while also grappling with the responsibilities of being recently released from prison and a young mother.

Comedy.title: WolfCop
Comedy.description: One evening during the late shift, Lou investigates a mysterious disturbance at the edge of town and wakes up with a pentagram carved in his chest, heightened senses and body hair that’s growing at an alarming rate.

Comedy.title: Woman at War
Comedy.description: Halla declares a one-woman-war on the local aluminum industry. But as she prepares to abandon her role as environmental activist to become a mother, she decides to plot one final attack to deal the aluminum industry a crippling blow.

Comedy.title: Wonder Park
Comedy.description: Wonder Park tells the story of a magnificent amusement park where the imagination of a wildly creative girl named June comes alive.

Comedy.title: The Year of Spectacular Men
Comedy.description: Izzy has a bad case of pre-real-world millennial-itis. She falls in and out of some not so romantic romances, and figures out that when it totally feels like the end of your story, it’s often just the beginning.

Comedy.title: You Laugh But It's True
Comedy.description: In the world of stand-up comedy in South Africa, Trevor Noah uses his experiences during Apartheid to prepare for the biggest show of his life.

Comedy.title: Zapped
Comedy.description: Zoey discovers a smartphone app that magically controls boys.

Crime.title: Accomplices
Crime.description: A dangerous affair between two sexy teens turns deadly when they enter a world of kinky love and sordid prostitution.

Crime.title: The Blue Room
Crime.description: Two adulterous lovers go from pillow talk to possible murder in this sexy, brain-teasing thriller. Mathieu Amalric (The Diving Bell and the Butterfly, Grand Budapest Hotel) directs and stars as Julien, a middle-aged salesman embroiled in a steamy love affair with a married woman who, after a round of kinky sex, makes a startling suggestion. Suddenly Julien is caught up in a police investigation—but just what exactly happened? Based on a novel by celebrated crime writer Georges Simenon, this beguiling cinematic puzzle keeps the audience guessing every step of the way.

Crime.title: Breaking the Girls
Crime.description: As the friendship between 2 beautiful women deepens, they embark on a murderous pact that escalates beyond their control in a twisted tale of seduction and betrayal.

Crime.title: Cartels
Crime.description: An elite team of DEA agents and a dangerous drug lord await extraction and find themselves trapped in an ambush!

Crime.title: The Chaser
Crime.description: In this gripping thriller, an ex-cop-turned-pimp must find a serial killer who is preying on call-girls and save the life of a woman who has gone missing.

Crime.title: A Ciambra
Crime.description: A teenage boy must grow up fast to survive life on the margins of Southern Italy in this bracing work of raw realism from executive producer Martin Scorsese.

Crime.title: The Con Is On
Crime.description: This stylish, star-studded caper comedy stars Uma Thurman and Tim Roth as a con-artist couple cooking up a jewel-theft scam in LA to pay off a sexy, deadly British gangster.

Crime.title: Deck the Halls
Crime.description: Based on the first book in Mary Higgins Clark and daughter Carol Higgins Clark's novels, this story brings together two of the authors' most popular characters: Cleaning-woman-turned-private-eye Alvirah, and Detective Reilly.

Crime.title: Dept Q: The Keeper of Lost Causes
Crime.description: Police inspector Carl Morck and his assistant investigate a cold case involving a missing woman.

Crime.title: Dept. Q: A Conspiracy of Faith
Crime.description: Department Q goes on the hunt for a serial killer when a desperate message, written in blood by two children, is found 14 years after they were kidnapped.

Crime.title: Dept. Q: The Absent One
Crime.description: The brutal, 20-year-old murder of a pair of twins is double the trouble for the detectives of Department Q in this gripping second installment in the blockbuster crime series.

Crime.title: Destroyer
Crime.description: Destroyer is a gritty, riveting and complex crime thriller starring Oscar-winner Nicole Kidman in a virtuoso performance as a hardened detective worn down by the rigors of her job and the aftermath of an undercover FBI sting gone horribly wrong.

Crime.title: Detroit
Crime.description: From the Academy Award winning director of THE HURT LOCKER and ZERO DARK THIRTY, DETROIT tells the gripping story of one of the most terrifying moments during the civil unrest that rocked Detroit in the summer of '67.

Crime.title: Diary of a Hitman
Crime.description: A hired killer struggles with his conscience when asked to perform his last hit on a young woman and her baby.

Crime.title: Dogman (2018)
Crime.description: Marcello is coerced into the petty criminal schemes of the local bully. When Simoncino’s abuse finally brings Marcello to a breaking point, he decides to stand up for his own dignity through an act of vengeance, with unintended consequences.

Crime.title: The French Connection
Crime.description: Gene Hackman stars in this 1971 Best Picture Oscar(R) winner about a maverick cop who stops a huge heroin shipment into New York.

Crime.title: The Fugitive
Crime.description: Harrison Ford stars as a doctor accused of killing his wife who goes on the lam in search of the real culprit. Tommy Lee Jones co-stars.

Crime.title: Gangster No. 1
Crime.description: GANGSTER NO. 1 chronicles the rise and fall of a prominent and ruthless English gangster.

Crime.title: Good Morning Killer
Crime.description: This thriller stars Catherine Bell as FBI Special Agent Ana Gray, an undercover operative tracking down a serial kidnapper. As Ana develops a rapport with the kidnapper's latest victim, the suspect suddenly changes his pattern.

Crime.title: Gridiron Gang
Crime.description: Dwayne "The Rock" Johnson (The Rundown, Walking Tall) stars in this gritty and inspirational movie, based on a true story about a group of teenage delinquents given a second chance to redeem themselves by playing football.

Crime.title: The Guilty
Crime.description: When a 911 dispatcher and former cop answers an emergency call from a kidnapped woman, he has to find a way to save her using just his phone and his wits in this pulse pounding, award-winning crime thriller. Danish, subtitled in English.

Crime.title: Hannie Caulder
Crime.description: A woman begins a lonely search for the bank robbers who murdered her husband.

Crime.title: Hide
Crime.description: In this movie based on Lisa Gardner's book, Carla Gugino plays Boston Police Detective D.D. Warren, who is called to the grounds of an abandoned mental hospital where a buried chamber is discovered.

Crime.title: Hornet's Nest
Crime.description: Robbie Amell, Michael Boatman and Michael Silver co-star in the first in this adaptation of the first novel in Cornwell's series of mysteries featuring reporter Andy Brazil, Police Chief Judy Hammer and her top deputy.

Crime.title: Hounds of Love
Crime.description: When Vicki Maloney is randomly abducted from a suburban street by a disturbed couple, she realizes she must drive a wedge between them if she is to survive.

Crime.title: If Beale Street Could Talk
Crime.description: Based on the novel by James Baldwin, "If Beale Street Could Talk" is a soulful drama about a young couple fighting for justice in the name of love and the promise of the American dream.

Crime.title: In the Fade
Crime.description: Katja’s husband and son are killed in a bomb attack. The mind numbing reasons behind the senseless act and eventual trial against the two suspects, a couple from the neo-Nazi scene, push Katja to the edge with no alternative but justice.

Crime.title: Inside Out
Crime.description: After being released from prison after serving 13 years, AJ's dreams of living a crime-free life soon come to an end when he discovers his childhood friend, Jack, has been marked for death.

Crime.title: Killers Anonymous
Crime.description: Tensions mount at KILLERS ANONYMOUS, a support group for killers, as the members of the group try to unravel a mystery: Which one of them is responsible for the assassination attempt on a U.S. senator that has the police in the city on high alert?

Crime.title: The Landing
Crime.description: A riveting investigation into the end of Apollo 18, the last US mission to the moon. Interviews conducted for the flight's 25th anniversary reveal new mysteries around the controversial tragedy that almost destroyed an American institution.

Crime.title: The Limehouse Golem
Crime.description: With the Limehouse Golem serial killer on the loose and taunting the police with messages written in blood, Inspector Kildare (Bill Nighy) must rely on help from a troubled witness (Olivia Cooke) to bring the killer to justice.

Crime.title: The Lincoln Lawyer
Crime.description: Michael "Mick" Haller, is a slick, charismatic Los Angeles criminal defense attorney who operates out of the back of his Lincoln Continental sedan.

Crime.title: Man on a Ledge
Crime.description: While a man teetering on a 21st-floor ledge diverts attention, the world’s greatest diamond heist is underway.

Crime.title: Maze
Crime.description: Based on the incredible true story of the 1983 mass break-out of 38 IRA prisoners from the HMP Maze high security prison, one prisoner engineers the largest European prison escape since World War II.

Crime.title: Middle Men
Crime.description: Businessman Jack Harris had the perfect life - a beautiful family and a successful career fixing problem companies. When Jack agrees to help steer two entrepreneurs business, he soon finds himself caught between a 23-year-old porn star and the FBI.

Crime.title: Mommy Group Murder
Crime.description: A new mom joins a local mommy group to help her deal with the stress that motherhood is putting on her and her marriage. But she soon learns that membership comes at a price.

Crime.title: Monsters and Men
Crime.description: A bystander films the death of a black man at the hands of police, which sparks rising tensions in a New York neighborhood as some are moved to take a stand.

Crime.title: Natural Born Killers
Crime.description: A young couple blast their way across the country--and into media stardom--in Oliver Stone's controversial look at violence and the media.

Crime.title: Out of Blue
Crime.description: Patricia Clarkson is a New Orleans detective whose hunt for a killer draws her into a mystery of cosmic proportions in this tantalizing noir thriller.

Crime.title: Paranoid Park
Crime.description: In this thriller from Gus Van Sant, a teen skater accidentally kills a security guard and slips into an inner world of mesmerizing paranoia.

Crime.title: The Prince
Crime.description: A former assassin is unwittingly drawn back into the life he gave up when he suspects that his daughter has been kidnapped.

Crime.title: Racer and the Jailbird
Crime.description: Loyalties are tested when a gangster and race car driver fall in love.

Crime.title: Ricochet
Crime.description: Two homicide detectives find their careers – and lives – on the line when they get caught up in a case of murder and betrayal in high-society Savannah.

Crime.title: Righteous Kill
Crime.description: Two veteran New York City detectives (Academy Award-winners Robert De Niro and Al Pacino) hunt a vigilante who may be one of their own.

Crime.title: Running with the Devil
Crime.description: When a cocaine shipment is compromised, a drug cartel’s CEO, known as The Boss orders his most trusted henchman, The Cook, and his partner, another master drug trafficker known as The Man, on a dangerous journey to audit the company’s supply chain.

Crime.title: Savage Youth
Crime.description: The lives of six troubled teens in a racially-divided town take a violent turn when drugs and broken hearts intermix. Based on true events.

Crime.title: Shoplifters
Crime.description: On the margins of Tokyo, a dysfunctional band of outsiders is united by fierce loyalty and a penchant for petty theft. When the young son is arrested, secrets are exposed that upend their tenuous, below-the-radar existence.

Crime.title: Silent Witness
Crime.description: In SILENT WITNESS, Dermot Mulroney stars as a prominent defense attorney who returns to his small hometown to defend an old friend accused of murder. Also starring Anne Heche.

Crime.title: Southie
Crime.description: Three years ago when Danny Quinn left Southie, a tough Irish working-class neighborhood in South Boston, he left behind a world of crime and betrayal. Upon his return, Danny is forced to make a risky decision.

Crime.title: The Standoff at Sparrow Creek
Crime.description: An ex-cop realizes that the shooter at a police funeral is one of his fellow militiamen and must use extreme measures to prevent further bloodshed.

Crime.title: Swimming With Sharks
Crime.description: A motion picture executive's assistant puts up with his abusive boss up to a point and then completely snaps, in this ultra-dark comedy from first-time director (and former Hollywood assistant) George Huang.

Crime.title: The Tall Man
Crime.description: Starring Jessica Biel. In an isolated town, children are vanishing without a trace and the locals believe a mysterious entity known as "The Tall Man" is responsible. Town nurse Julia is a skeptic, until her own child disappears.

Crime.title: Tenderness
Crime.description: Lori Cranston (Sophie Traub) is a confused fifteen-year-old dreamer in search of an escape from her troubled home life. She discovers and becomes enthralled with Eric (Jon Foster), a young man with a violent past.

Crime.title: Terminal
Crime.description: Margot Robbie, Simon Pegg and Mike Myers star in this twisted tale of two assassins carrying out a sinister mission, a teacher battling a fatal illness, an enigmatic janitor and a waitress leading a dangerous double life.

Crime.title: Wild Card
Crime.description: Nick Wild is a Las Vegas bodyguard with lethal professional skills and a personal gambling problem. When a friend is beaten by a sadistic thug, Nick strikes back, only to find out the thug is the son of a powerful mob boss

Documentaries.title: 78/52: Hitchcock's Shower Scene
Documentaries.description: Just when you thought it was safe to go back in the shower... Discover how Alfred Hitchcock's Psycho changed film history forever with one shocking scene.

Documentaries.title: Above and Beyond: NASA's Journey to Tomorrow
Documentaries.description: Directed, produced, and narrated by Academy Award®-nominated and Emmy®-winning Rory Kennedy, the film examines the ways NASA has changed not only our vision of the universe, but also our planet, and ourselves.

Documentaries.title: Above Majestic
Documentaries.description: A provocative look at what it takes to hide a multi-trillion dollar Secret Space Program from the public and the implications this has for humanity. Featuring David Wilcock, Corey Goode, John Desouza, Niara Isley, Jordan Sather, and more.

Documentaries.title: Active Measures
Documentaries.description: ACTIVE MEASURES chronicles the most successful espionage operation in Russian history, the US presidential election of 2016. Filmmakers expose an insidious plot devised by Putin to disrupt and control world events.

Documentaries.title: Addicted to Sexting
Documentaries.description: ADDICTED TO SEXTING is a compelling (and sometimes humorous) look at the rise and proliferation of this social phenomenon from several varying perspectives and how the lives of those engaged in it are affected.

Documentaries.title: After Parkland
Documentaries.description: In the days after the shooting at Marjory Stoneman Douglas High School in 2018 that killed 17 people and launched a nationwide student movement. filmmakers embedded with students and families whose lives were forever transformed.

Documentaries.title: After the Screaming Stops
Documentaries.description: A raw and emotional look into the aftermath of fame and the reconnection between two twins torn apart by their past.

Documentaries.title: Alive
Documentaries.description: Alive follows the journeys of a number of veterans who turn to adaptive athletics to help them heal both physically and emotionally from their battle wounds.

Documentaries.title: Along for the Ride
Documentaries.description: Filmmaker Nick Ebeling profiles the professional exile and eventual re-emergence of Dennis Hopper following the making of "The Last Movie."

Documentaries.title: Amazing Grace
Documentaries.description: A documentary presenting the live recording of Aretha Franklin's album Amazing Grace at The New Temple Missionary Baptist Church in Watts, Los Angeles in January 1972.

Documentaries.title: The Amazing Johnathan Documentary
Documentaries.description: What begins as a seemingly ordinary profile of a dying magician becomes an unexpected and increasingly bizarre journey as filmmaker Ben Berman struggles to separate truth from illusion.

Documentaries.title: American Relapse
Documentaries.description:
Frankie and Allie fight to make a difference against the devastating heroin epidemic. The two recovering addicts spend their lives pulling needles out of the arms of active users. But after that problem is solved, the addicts must be placed into the proper treatment facility. Sadly, the corrupt billion-dollar treatment industry has made this choice difficult...and dangerous. 
It’s a struggle against the odds, in an “Us vs. the world” mentality. They allowed the film crew all access for one weekend. What transpires over 72 hours is a heartbreaking account of addicts struggling to survive.

Documentaries.title: Amy Winehouse: A Final Goodbye
Documentaries.description: A Final Goodbye is an intimate look into the life and times of Amy Winehouse from her rise to pop superstardom through to the inner demons that inspired her work and eventually caused her untimely death.

Documentaries.title: Andy Irons: Kissed by God
Documentaries.description: Three-time world champion surfer Andy Irons quietly battled bipolar disorder and opioid addiction throughout his life - demons that millions of others combat daily. His previously untold story tears down myths associated with the diseases.

Documentaries.title: Apollo 11
Documentaries.description: Crafted from a newly-discovered trove of 70mm footage, and more than 11,000 hours of uncatalogued audio recordings, Apollo 11 goes straight to the heart of NASA's most celebrated mission.

Documentaries.title: Ask Dr. Ruth
Documentaries.description: Ask Dr. Ruth chronicles the incredible life of Dr. Ruth Westheimer, a Holocaust survivor who became America's most famous sex therapist. As her 90th birthday approaches, she revisits her painful past and career at the forefront of the sexual revolution.

Documentaries.title: Augie
Documentaries.description: Augie Nieto embarks on an inspirational journey after being diagnosed with amyotrophic lateral sclerosis. With help from his wife, friends and colleagues, Nieto raises more than $55 million to fund scientific research to battle the disease.

Documentaries.title: Back in Time
Documentaries.description: Back in Time is a look at the impact the Back to the Future movies have had on our culture. From Spielberg to Zemeckis, Lloyd and Fox, paired with amazing trilogy fans, Back in Time features interviews and footage that must be seen.

Documentaries.title: Bad Reputation
Documentaries.description: The life and career of Joan Jett from her early years ripping it up onstage as the founder and backbone of hard-rock legends The Runaways, to her solo career and the enduring presence as a rock 'n' roll pioneer and mentor.

Documentaries.title: Ballet 422
Documentaries.description: Filmmaker Jody Lee Lipes follows emerging choreographer Justin Peck as he undertakes the difficult tasks of creating and dancing in the New York City Ballet's 422nd original piece.

Documentaries.title: Ballet Now
Documentaries.description: Featuring New York City Ballet’s Prima Ballerina Tiler Peck - the first ever woman to be asked to curate The Music Center’s famed BalletNOW program - and a diverse cast of world-class dancers from around the globe, the film follows Tiler as she tries to execute her groundbreaking vision of mashing together the worlds of tap, hip-hop, ballet and even clown artistry. With less than a week to pull it all off, Tiler faces the mounting pressures of not only dancing in multiple pieces but also producing and directing this high profile event. The success of the performances rests squarely on her shoulders. Will she pull it off?

Documentaries.title: Banking on Bitcoin
Documentaries.description: An ideological battle is underway between fringe utopists and mainstream capitalism. Banking on Bitcoin takes a look at what this revolutionary technology is and the players who are battling to define how it will shape our lives.

Documentaries.title: Batman & Bill
Documentaries.description: For years, Bob Kane has been credited as Batman's creator. As time passed, rumors swirled that the Caped Crusader had another father.  Who was this man? Batman & Bill tells the story of the uncredited creator of Batman, and a crusade to bring him justice.

Documentaries.title: The Beatles: Eight Days a Week - The Touring Years
Documentaries.description: In 1962 four young men John Lennon, Paul McCartney, George Harrison and Ringo Starr came together to form the 20th century musical phenomenon known as, "The Beatles."  The band stormed Europe in 1963, and, in 1964, they conquered America.

Documentaries.title: Becoming Bond
Documentaries.description: A Hulu Original Documentary chronicling the bizarre true story of George Lazenby, an Australian car mechanic, who managed to land the role of James Bond despite never acting a day in his life.

Documentaries.title: Beers of Joy
Documentaries.description: Beers of Joy is a fascinating, entertaining, and savory journey into our world’s favorite magical elixir. Feast upon stunning visuals from across the globe as four people immerse themselves in their passion for beer.

Documentaries.title: Best of Enemies
Documentaries.description: In 1968, ideological opposites William F. Buckley Jr. and Gore Vidal hold a series of riveting, nationally televised debates that usher in a new era of public discourse and pundit TV.

Documentaries.title: Big Voice
Documentaries.description: A year in the life of a demanding high school choir teacher who pushes his students to become “one big voice” in this inspiring musical documentary.

Documentaries.title: Bigfoot Girl
Documentaries.description: After encountering Bigfoot as a child, Kiana instantly felt a connection with the creature. With the help of other experiencers, she sets out to secret locations with recent sightings to find closure to the biggest question of her life.

Documentaries.title: The Biggest Little Farm
Documentaries.description: The Biggest Little Farm follows two dreamers and their beloved dog when they make a choice that takes them from their tiny L.A. apartment and into the countryside to build one of the most diverse farms of its kind in complete coexistence with nature.

Documentaries.title: Blackfish
Documentaries.description: Killer whales are beloved, majestic, friendly giants, yet infamous for their capacity to kill viciously. Blackfish unravels the complexities of this dichotomy, employing the story of the notorious performing whale Tilikum.

Documentaries.title: Blue Gold: American Jeans
Documentaries.description: BLUE GOLD: American Jeans is weaving together the story of how one garment is connecting us all. Starting our journey in the American West, we travel around the world with jeans hunter Eric Schrader. An ambassador of Americana, Eric is trading in the history and values that have made Blue Jeans the most expensive and sought after piece of vintage clothing on the planet. A symbol of youth, freedom, and rebellion, Blue Jeans leads us through fashion history, music, and subculture dreams, to the lost tradition of American manufacturing – exploring the responsibility of Americana in a globalized world of cultural exchange, transparency, and innovation.

Documentaries.title: Bogalusa Charm
Documentaries.description: Through the lens of an anachronistic charm school that has existed for almost three decades in rural Louisiana, we explore a town confronted with contemporary issues of class and race.

Documentaries.title: Boom for Real: The Late Teenage Years of Jean-Michel Basquiat
Documentaries.description: Follow Basquiat's life pre-fame and how New York City, the times, the people and the movements surrounding him formed the artist he became.

Documentaries.title: The Brink (2019)
Documentaries.description: The Brink follows Steve Bannon leading up to the 2018 mid-term elections in the United States. A keen manipulator of the press Bannon continues to draw headlines and protests wherever he goes, feeding the powerful myth on which his survival relies.

Documentaries.title: Burden
Documentaries.description: An unprecedented look into the life of conceptual artist and sculptor Chris Burden. Chris Burden guaranteed his place in art history in the 1970s with a series of often dangerous and at times stomach-churning performances. After having himself shot in Santa Ana, confined to a locker for five days in Irvine and crucified on the back of a VW bug in Venice, Burden reinvented himself as the creator of truly mesmerizing installations and sculptures, from a suspended gigantic flywheel that seemingly spins on its own to an assemblage of illuminated, antique streetlights outside the Los Angeles County Museum of Art, Urban Light (2008), which has become one of Los Angeles’ most photographed and iconic symbols. In Burden, Timothy Marrinan and Richard Dewey look at the artist’s work and private life with an innovative mix of still-potent videos of his 70s performances, personal films and audio recordings, latter day footage at his Topanga Canyon studio and comments from friends, fellow students, colleagues and critics, all peppered with Burden’s thoughts and musings from throughout the years.

Documentaries.title: Burn
Documentaries.description: An action-packed documentary about Detroit told through the eyes of firefighters charged with the thankless task of saving a city that many have written off as dead.

Documentaries.title: The Cage Fighter
Documentaries.description: A mixed martial arts competitor risks everything—his family, his marriage, even his life—to keep fighting in this riveting, true-life tale of resilience.

Documentaries.title: A Cam Life
Documentaries.description: An undaunted look into the cam business from performers and clients to website and studio owners.

Documentaries.title: Cannabis Evolution
Documentaries.description: Science has confirmed marijuana has the potential to treat physical and mental conditions, from cancer to PTSD. But the war on drugs has stifled millions in need of help - time to dispel the lies and address the facts.

Documentaries.title: Cartel Land
Documentaries.description: Filmmaker Matthew Heineman and Executive Producer Kathryn Bigelow (“The Hurt Locker”, “Zero Dark Thirty”) bring us this unprecedented look at two vigilante groups fighting the murderous drug cartels on both sides of the Mexican border.

Documentaries.title: The Cave
Documentaries.description: The Cave paints a stirring portrait of courage, resilience and female solidarity inside a subterranean hospital in Syria run by a young, female pediatrician.

Documentaries.title: The Challenge
Documentaries.description: Italian visual artist Yuri Ancarani’s exquisite documentary enters the surreal world of wealthy Qatari sheikhs with a passion for amateur falconry. The opulence of this Middle Eastern gas state  is on full display as the men race SUVs up and down sand dunes, fly their prized falcons around on private jets, and take their pet cheetahs out for desert spins in their souped-up Ferraris. The result is a film jaw-dropping not only for its displays of wealth, but for the pure cinematic beauty that won Ancarani the Filmmaker of the Present award at the 2016 Locarno Film Festival.

Documentaries.title: Chef Flynn
Documentaries.description: Ten-year-old Flynn McGarry transforms his living room into a supper club using his classmates as line cooks. Achieving sudden fame, Flynn outgrows his bedroom kitchen and sets out to challenge the hierarchy of the culinary world.

Documentaries.title: The China Hustle
Documentaries.description: From the producers of Enron: The Smartest Guys In The Room, a Wall Street heist story about Chinese companies, the US stock market and a still-unfolding financial crime so big, it has the power to affect all of our wallets.

Documentaries.title: Citizen Jane: Battle for the City
Documentaries.description: Citizen Jane is a timely tale of what can happen when engaged citizens fight the power for the sake of a better world. Arguably no one did more to shape our understanding of the modern American city than Jane Jacobs, the visionary activist and writer who fought to preserve urban communities in the face of destructive development projects. Director Matt Tyranuer (Valentino: The Last Emperor) vividly brings to life Jacobs' 1960s showdown with ruthless construction kingpin Robert Moses over his plan to raze lower Manhattan to make way for a highway, a dramatic struggle over the very soul of the neighborhood.

Documentaries.title: Climate Warriors
Documentaries.description: CLIMATE WARRIORS presents people who show resistance against the devastating effects of climate change. They show that we need a fast transition in order to save the environment and keep the human rights in balance in favor of peace.

Documentaries.title: The Clintons: An American Odyssey
Documentaries.description: There is no parallel to the remarkable lives of William and Hillary Clinton - it's all here in an insightful time capsule, telling one of America's greatest personal and political stories.

Documentaries.title: Cold Case Hammarskjöld
Documentaries.description: Danish director Mads Brügger and Swedish private investigator Göran Bjorkdahl are trying to solve the mysterious death of Dag Hammarskjöld. As their investigation closes in, they discover a crime with even farther reaching consequences.

Documentaries.title: Comrades & Cash: How Money Found Its Way Through the Iron Curtain
Documentaries.description: Communist East Germany is on the brink of bankruptcy, so it forges dark alliances and created a global businesses network which sold anything possible. This is the true story that inspired Deutschland ’86.

Documentaries.title: The Coolest Guy Movie Ever: Return to the Scene of The Great Escape
Documentaries.description: THE COOLEST GUY MOVIE EVER is the definitive look at the making of the 1963 classic, "The Great Escape."

Documentaries.title: Crazy About Tiffany's
Documentaries.description: A provocative and rare glimpse at the most iconic luxury jeweler in the world. From past to present, discovering the behind the scenes creation to those beholden to its charm, Crazy About Tiffany's unveils Tiffany & Co. like never before.

Documentaries.title: Crime + Punishment
Documentaries.description: This film chronicles the real struggles of a group of whistleblower cops in NYC as they fight back against the illegal arrest quotas they’re pressured to abide by.

Documentaries.title: Culture Shock: A Conversation With Director Gigi Saul Guerrero
Documentaries.description: Director Gigi Saul Guerrero talks through Culture Shock’s themes—immigration, filmmaking, and latinidad—in this one-on-one chat.

Documentaries.title: Dancer
Documentaries.description: Bad boy ballet superstar Sergei Polunin was the youngest principal male dancer in the Royal Ballet until stardom pushed him to the brink of self-destruction.

Documentaries.title: Dancing in Jaffa
Documentaries.description: Pierre Dulaine, an internationally renowned ballroom dancer, fulfills a life-long dream when he takes his program, Dancing Classrooms, back to his city of birth, Jaffa. Over a ten-week period, Pierre teaches 10-year-old Palestinian-Israeli and Jewish-Israeli children to dance and compete together. Dancing in Jaffa explores the complex stories of three different children, who are forced to confront issues of identity, segregation and racial prejudice as they dance with their enemy. The classroom becomes a microcosm of the Middle East's struggle to work together harmoniously while still caught in the politics of the region and race. With the guidance of Pierre, the children learn to dance together and trust one another. Dancing In Jaffa offers an up-close-and-personal perspective of how the future might unfold if the art of movement and dance could triumph over the politics of history and geography.

Documentaries.title: Dealt
Documentaries.description: Prepare to be inspired and amazed by Richard Turner, one of the world's most renowned card magicians, who met adversity head-on and refused to let his disability define him.

Documentaries.title: Diana Vreeland: The Eye Has to Travel
Documentaries.description: This is an intimate portrait and a vibrant celebration of one of the most influential women of the 20th century, an enduring icon whose influence changed the face of fashion, beauty, art, publishing, and culture forever.

Documentaries.title: Dina
Documentaries.description: In this 2017 Sundance and IDA award-winning film, Dina, an eccentric and outspoken suburban woman and Scott, a Walmart door greeter, navigate their evolving relationship in this unconventional love story.

Documentaries.title: Dior and I
Documentaries.description: Dior and I brings the viewer inside the storied world of the Christian Dior fashion house with a privileged, behind-the-scenes look at the creation of Raf Simons’ first haute couture collection as its new artistic director.

Documentaries.title: Dirty Wars
Documentaries.description: It's the dirty little secret of the War on Terror: all bets are off, and almost anything goes. We have fundamentally changed the rules of the game and the rules of engagement. Today drone strikes, night raids, and U.S. government–condoned torture occur in corners across the globe, generating unprecedented civilian casualties. Investigative reporter Jeremy Scahill (author of Blackwater: The Rise of the World's Most Mercenary Army) traces the rise of the Joint Special Operations Command, the most secret fighting force in U.S. history, exposing operations carried out by men who do not exist on paper and will never appear before Congress. No target is off-limits for the JSOC "kill list," even a U.S. citizen. Director Richard Rowley takes us on a chilling ride with whistle-blower Scahill. Dirty Wars is a battle cry for the soul and conscience of an America few of us know exists.

Documentaries.title: Divide and Conquer: The Story of Roger Ailes
Documentaries.description: The rise and fall of Roger Ailes, controversial Fox News mogul and Republican king-maker. One of the most powerful and divisive figures in media, Ailes would go down in flames amid scandal, paranoia, and multiple sexual harassment allegations.

Documentaries.title: Do I Sound Gay?
Documentaries.description: What makes a voice "gay?" This witty, entertaining look at a controversial topic features candid interviews with Dan Savage, David Sedaris, George Takei, and Margaret Cho.

Documentaries.title: Dr. Feelgood: Dealer or Healer?
Documentaries.description: The story of Dr. William Hurwitz - a preeminent pain specialist sentenced to 25 years in prison - provides a window into the ethical dilemma of opioid prescriptions. Painkillers give doctors tremendous power to relieve pain, a primary goal of any physician. But this power begets trouble when the same drugs can lead to addiction, abuse and death. The documentary traces Dr. Hurwitz's trial, detailing the events that lead to his arrest. Testimonies from witnesses in the case contradict one another - some revere him, while others condemn him. Taken together, their accounts reveal a portrait of a compassion yet flawed doctor. The film underscores the tension between every patient's right to pain relief and the lawful need for drug control. In 2016 prescription drugs kill more Americans than HIV or homicide, and more than heroin and cocaine combined. There could not be a more critical time to spark a discussion on this topic and call for careful though and action.

Documentaries.title: Dumb: The Story of Big Brother Magazine
Documentaries.description: The history of the boundary-pushing, taboo-breaking, crassly-humorous Big Brother magazine, that spawned MTV's "Jackass" and a generation of skaters.

Documentaries.title: Dust 2 Glory
Documentaries.description: Filmmaker Dana Brown explores the SCORE Baja 1000, the world's toughest, point-to-point desert race.

Documentaries.title: Eating Animals
Documentaries.description: What's on your plate? Natalie Portman and Jonathan Safran Foer present this eye-opening look at the food industry and an ethical future free of factory farming.

Documentaries.title: El Pantera
Documentaries.description: EL PANTERA is a documentary film that chronicles the rise of Mexican MMA star Yair Rodriguez aka El Pantera as he embarks on his journey to become the first ever Mexican born UFC Champion.

Documentaries.title: Far From the Tree
Documentaries.description: Discover the courage of compassion through the eyes of parents journeying towards acceptance of their unique children. Based on The New York Times bestseller.

Documentaries.title: Fighter
Documentaries.description: Filmmaker Amir Bar-Lev follows two Czech Holocaust survivors, Jan Weiner and Arnost Lustig, as they revisit Terezin, a labor camp where Arnost was interned for five years and Jan's mother was murdered.

Documentaries.title: The First Monday in May
Documentaries.description: Follows the creation of The Metropolitan Museum of Art's most attended fashion exhibition in history, "China: Through The Looking Glass," an exploration of Chinese-inspired Western fashions by Costume Institute curator Andrew Bolton.

Documentaries.title: Fittest on Earth: A Decade of Fitness
Documentaries.description: Forty of the world's top athletes battle through 15 events and five grueling days of competition for the title of Fittest on Earth. Who will rise to the top and prove the fittest?

Documentaries.title: Food Choices
Documentaries.description: This new ground-breaking documentary explores the impact that food choices have on people’s health, the health of our planet and on the lives of other living species. And also discusses several misconceptions about food and diet.

Documentaries.title: Food Evolution
Documentaries.description: Amidst a brutally polarized debate marked by passion, suspicion and confusion, FOOD EVOLUTION, by Academy Award®-nominated director Scott Hamilton Kennedy (The Garden, Fame High, OT: Our Town), explores the controversy surrounding GMOs and food. Traveling from Hawaiian papaya groves, to banana farms in Uganda to the cornfields of Iowa, the film, narrated by esteemed science communicator Neil deGrasse Tyson, wrestles with the emotions and the science driving one of the most heated arguments of our time.

Documentaries.title: Food, Inc.
Documentaries.description: Food Inc. reveals surprising - and often shocking - truths about what we eat, how it's produced, and who we have become as a nation.

Documentaries.title: Framing John DeLorean
Documentaries.description: Money, power, politics, drugs, scandal, and fast cars. Discover the untold story of the controversial automaker's meteoric rise and shocking fall. Featuring Alec Baldwin.

Documentaries.title: Frank Serpico
Documentaries.description: The courageous police officer known for exposing corruption within the NYPD and inspiring the Al Pacino classic recounts his incredible story in his own words.

Documentaries.title: Free Solo
Documentaries.description: Free solo climber Alex Honnold prepares to achieve his lifelong dream: scaling the 3,200-foot El Capitan in Yosemite National Park without a rope.

Documentaries.title: Funke
Documentaries.description: Acclaimed Chef Evan Funke mounts his culinary comeback - an ode to the dying art of handmade pasta - on the most competitive street in America where he finds himself fighting to fulfill his artistic destiny while battling the impossibly volatile LA restaurant industry.

Documentaries.title: FYRE FRAUD
Documentaries.description: Fyre Festival was the defining scam of the millennial generation, at the nexus of social media influence, late-stage capitalism, and morality in the post-truth era. Marketing for the 2017 music event went viral with the help of rapper Ja Rule, Instagram stars, and models, but turned epic fail after stranding thousands in the Bahamas. Featuring an exclusive interview with Billy McFarland, the convicted con-man behind the festival; FYRE FRAUD is a true-crime comedy bolstered by a cast of whistleblowers, victims, and insiders going beyond the spectacle to uncover the power of FOMO and an ecosystem of enablers, driven by profit and a lack of accountability in the digital age.

Documentaries.title: The Gardener
Documentaries.description: Created over 75 years and three generations, Les Quatre Vents stands as an enchanted place of beauty and surprise, a horticultural masterpiece of the 21st century. See how Frank Cabot gave birth to one of the greatest gardens in the world.

Documentaries.title: Gilbert
Documentaries.description: Gilbert Gottfried rose to fame in the 1980’s thanks to his brash stand-up act and personality. Now, after decades of flying solo in both his work and in his personal life, Gilbert has shockingly reinvented himself…as a family man.

Documentaries.title: Glen Campbell: I'll Be Me
Documentaries.description: This film documents Glen's amazing "Goodbye Tour" as he and his family attempt to navigate the wildly unpredictable nature of his progressing Alzheimer's disease using love, laughter and music as their medicine of choice.

Documentaries.title: Go Tigers!
Documentaries.description: The residents of Massillon, Ohio live and breathe through their high school football team. This documentary shows how three young football stars carry the burden of victory for their team, their school and their town.

Documentaries.title: The Gospel According to André
Documentaries.description: This intimate portrait for André Leon Tally, a fixture in the world of fashion, takes viewers on a journey from André’s roots growing up to becoming one of the most influential tastemakers and fashion curators of our times.

Documentaries.title: Grace Jones: Bloodlight and Bami
Documentaries.description: A larger-than-life entertainer, an androgynous glam-pop diva – Grace Jones is all these things and more. Sophie Fiennes’s documentary goes beyond the traditional music biography, offering a portrait as stylish and unconventional as its subject.

Documentaries.title: Hail Satan?
Documentaries.description: Hail Satan? offers a look at a group of misunderstood outsiders whose commitment to social and political justice has empowered thousands of people. An inspiring and entertaining documentary from acclaimed director Penny Lane (Nuts!, Our Nixon).

Documentaries.title: Havana Motor Club
Documentaries.description: Cuban drag racers prepare for the first sanctioned race in their country since 1960. This documentary offers a fascinating glimpse at the ingenuity of the competitive spirit.

Documentaries.title: Hillbilly
Documentaries.description: Hillbilly seeks to expand understanding of Appalachia, tracing the evolution of the `hillbilly' stereotype in media and culture by connecting it to corporate exploitation of the region's natural resources.

Documentaries.title: Honeyland
Documentaries.description: Hatidze lives with her ailing mother in Macedonia, making a living cultivating honey using ancient beekeeping traditions. When an unruly family moves in next door, what at first seems like a balm for her solitude becomes a source of tension.

Documentaries.title: Hot Grease
Documentaries.description: The surprising story of how the bio-diesel industry is turning an ostensibly worthless raw material- spent kitchen grease- into a green energy source capable of fueling all of the trains, ships, and trucks throughout the country.

Documentaries.title: Hunt for the Skinwalker
Documentaries.description: Hundreds of reports of phenomena at Skinwalker Ranch have made it one of the most famous paranormal hotspots in the world. Previously unreleased footage and interviews from the scientific study piece together what could be happening there.

Documentaries.title: Hurley
Documentaries.description: In the 1970’s, Hurley Haywood was the dominant force in motor racing, but his personal life remained a mystery. Hurley chronicles a remarkable life, revealing a greater insight into the tightrope walk between career and personal life.

Documentaries.title: I Know a Woman Like That
Documentaries.description: I KNOW A WOMAN LIKE THAT brings to its audience interviews with 17 exceptional and vigorous women who share an extraordinary attitude about how to live the upper decades of one's life.

Documentaries.title: In Search of Greatness
Documentaries.description: IN SEARCH OF GREATNESS is a groundbreaking documentary that reveals the true nature and nurture of the greatest athletes of all time

Documentaries.title: Iris (2014)
Documentaries.description: From legendary documentarian Albert Maysles (GREY GARDENS, GIMME SHELTER), IRIS pairs the late 88-year-old filmmaker with Iris Apfel, the quick-witted, flamboyantly dressed 93-year-old style maven who has had an outsized presence on the New York fashion scene for decades. More than a fashion film, the documentary is a story about creativity and how a soaring free spirit continues to inspire.

Documentaries.title: Jackass 3
Documentaries.description: Johnny Knoxville and the rest of his friends (Bam Margera, Ryan Dunn, Steve-O) perform outrageous stunts and pranks.

Documentaries.title: JACO
Documentaries.description: "JACO" tells the story of Jaco Pastorius, a self-taught, larger-than-life musician who single-handedly changed the course of modern music by redefining the sound and the role of the electric bass guitar.

Documentaries.title: Jane
Documentaries.description: Director Brett Morgen presents an intimate portrait of Jane Goodall's groundbreaking chimpanzee research.

Documentaries.title: Jawline
Documentaries.description: This film follows 16-year-old Austyn Tester, a rising star in the live-broadcast ecosystem who built his following on wide-eyed optimism and teen girl lust, as he tries to escape a dead-end life in rural Tennessee.

Documentaries.title: Jerry Lewis: The Man Behind the Clown
Documentaries.description: While Americans viewed Lewis as nothing more than just a clown, others like the French recognized him as a true auteur, giving birth to questions that have perplexed American pop culture for over 50 years: Why do Europeans love Jerry Lewis?

Documentaries.title: Jiro Dreams of Sushi
Documentaries.description: This is the story of 85-year-old Jiro Ono, considered by many to be the world’s greatest sushi chef. He is the proprietor of Sukiyabashi Jiro, a 10-seat, sushi-only restaurant inauspiciously located in a Tokyo subway station.

Documentaries.title: Joe Strummer: The Future Is Unwritten
Documentaries.description: Julien Temple's electrifying Sundance rock-doc is about The Clash's Joe Strummer, the punk icon whose message has inspired Bono, Johnny Depp, John Cusack and more.

Documentaries.title: Julian Schnabel: A Private Portrait
Documentaries.description: Julian Schnabel: A Private Portrait chronicles the personal life and public career of the celebrated painter and filmmaker Julian Schnabel, whose acclaimed work has turned him into a superstar in the international art world.

Documentaries.title: K2: Beyond the Comfort Zone
Documentaries.description: Adventurer Mike Horn and his friends travel through 13 countries in an  attempt  to  ascend the  most  difficult mountain  in  the world. Immersing  into different cultures and breathtaking landscapes, they get closer to climbing K2.

Documentaries.title: Keepers of the Magic
Documentaries.description: This groundbreaking documentary explores our fascination with moving images and provides insight into how cinema's most iconic moments came to be.

Documentaries.title: Kiki
Documentaries.description: 25 years after 'Paris Is Burning' introduced the art of voguing to the world, Kiki revisits New York City's thriving underground ballroom scene. It's a larger-than-life world in which LGBTQ youths of color are empowered by staging elaborate dance competitions that showcase their dynamic choreography, fabulous costumes, and fierce attitude. It's also a safe haven for struggling, at-risk teens who find acceptance, support, and friendship within the Kiki community. Granted intimate access to the scene, filmmaker Sara Jordenö introduces viewers to some of Kiki culture's most prominent personalities, going beyond the glamour of the balls to highlight the serious challenges facing queer black and Latino young people. Bringing together heartrending personal stories with incredible displays of creative expression, Kiki is 'exhilarating…an indelible, must-see ode to gay New York' (Manohla Dargis, The New York Times).

Documentaries.title: Killing for Love
Documentaries.description: What could drive an innocent man to take the fall for a crime he didn't commit? A shocking true tale of obsessive love, betrayal, and murder.

Documentaries.title: Killing Them Safely
Documentaries.description: Electronic guns, the high-tech alternative to bullets, are used by every police officer nationwide. Are they saving lives? Or killing people? This is the eye-opening story.

Documentaries.title: Kim Dotcom: Caught in the Web
Documentaries.description: Kim Dotcom, the "most wanted man online," battles the U.S. government and entertainment industry over issues of ownership, privacy and piracy in the digital age.

Documentaries.title: Kusama: Infinity
Documentaries.description: The top-selling female artist in the world, Yayoi Kusama overcame impossible odds to bring her radical artistic vision to the world stage. People are experiencing her installation Infinity Mirrored Rooms, as she continues to create new work every day.

Documentaries.title: Kygo: Stole the Show - Director's Cut
Documentaries.description: Stole The Show, featuring Bono, Steve Aoki, and Martin Garrix, drops us into the heart of the music streaming revolution, using Kygo's first arena show as a lens to examine not only Kygo's rise but the rise of streaming.

Documentaries.title: Larger Than Life: The Kevyn Aucoin Story
Documentaries.description: A pioneer of contour techniques, makeup artist Kevyn Aucoin’s meteoric rise to fame in the 80’s and 90’s was legendary. Iconic clients, friends, and family retrace his life, career, and mysterious death at the height of his fame in 2002.

Documentaries.title: The Last Race
Documentaries.description: The DNA of NASCAR, independent stock car racing is a dying art that’s still hanging on at an iconic Long Island track. Electrifying racing footage is intertwined with the story of a small town trying to retain its identity.

Documentaries.title: Leaning Into the Wind: Andy Goldsworthy
Documentaries.description: Sixteen years after the groundbreaking film Rivers and Tides director Thomas Riedelsheimer returns to work with the artist. The film follows Andy on his exploration of the layers of his world and the impact of the years on himself and his art.

Documentaries.title: Legion of Brothers
Documentaries.description: Immediately after the 9/11 attacks, less than 100 US Troops were sent on a secret mission to overthrow the Taliban. What happens next is equal parts war origin story & cautionary tale, illuminating the impact of 15 years of constant combat.

Documentaries.title: Life, Animated
Documentaries.description: From Academy Award® winning director Roger Ross Williams comes the story of Owen Suskind, a young man who couldn’t speak as a child until he discovered a unique way to communicate by immersing himself in the world of Disney animated films.

Documentaries.title: Light in the Water
Documentaries.description: In 1982 soon after the first Gay Games, West Hollywood Aquatics registered as the first openly gay masters swim team in the world. This athletic powerhouse fought injustice in the world of competitive sports, and ultimately became a family.

Documentaries.title: Lo and Behold: Reveries of the Connected World
Documentaries.description: Oscar®-nominated documentarian Werner Herzog (Grizzly Man, Cave of Forgotten Dreams) chronicles the virtual world from its origins to its outermost reaches.

Documentaries.title: Long Time Coming: A 1955 Baseball Story
Documentaries.description: Sixty years after integrating Little League baseball in the South, the pioneering players embark on a personal journey and question the ballgame’s historic significance while trying to navigate America’s lingering racial divisions.

Documentaries.title: Love, Gilda
Documentaries.description: A joyous, moving celebration of the life of the first superstar of Saturday Night Live. Gilda Radner's jubilant spark is captured through private audiotapes, home movies and diaries in this salute to her indomitable spirit.

Documentaries.title: Madonna and the Breakfast Club
Documentaries.description: The incredible untold story of pop icon Madonna’s struggling pre-fame years in New York City with her musician boyfriend, Dan Gilroy, and their first band Breakfast Club.

Documentaries.title: Making a Killing: Guns, Greed, and the NRA
Documentaries.description: This powerful documentary tells the stories of tragic shootings through the eyes of survivors and family members and how National Rifle Association (NRA) has lobbied for gun manufacturers who pay their bills and set their agenda.

Documentaries.title: March of the Penguins 2: The Next Step
Documentaries.description: Filmmaker Luc Jacquet returns to the Antarctic to visit the Emperor Penguins who call the frozen continent home. March of the Penguins 2, tells the story of two penguins, as they face the unimaginable challenges of life in this hostile land.

Documentaries.title: Margaret Atwood: A Word After a Word After a Word is Power
Documentaries.description: Poet and novelist, Margaret Atwood is a household name. Yet few know the private Margaret Atwood. Who is the woman and writer behind these stories?

Documentaries.title: Meeting Gorbachev
Documentaries.description: Werner Herzog meeting Mikhail Gorbachev opens a fresh door to some of the most significant happenings of the late 20th Century from nuclear disarmament to the reunification of Germany and the end of the Cold War.

Documentaries.title: Michael Jackson: Life, Death and Legacy
Documentaries.description: Following the recent imprisonment of Jackson's doctor Conrad Murray for involuntary manslaughter, we are taken on a journey through the extraordinary life of Michael Jackson from his debut in the Jackson 5 to his untimely death in 2009.

Documentaries.title: Mike Wallace Is Here
Documentaries.description: An unflinching look at the legendary reporter, who interrogated the 20th century’s biggest figures in his over fifty years on air, and his aggressive reporting style and showmanship that redefined what America came to expect from broadcasters.

Documentaries.title: Minding the Gap
Documentaries.description: Filmmaker Bing Liu searches for correlations between his skateboarder friends' turbulent upbringings and the complexities of modern-day masculinity.

Documentaries.title: Monkey Business: The Adventures of Curious George’s Creators
Documentaries.description: Featuring a narrow escape from the Nazis on makeshift bicycles, MONKEY BUSINESS explores the extraordinary lives of Hans and Margret Rey, the authors of the beloved Curious George children’s books.

Documentaries.title: Neat: The Story of Bourbon
Documentaries.description: "Neat" dives into the rich and storied world of bourbon. Exploring its colorful history, charismatic characters, and uniquely American process, the film is a celebration of the artistry that makes America’s only native spirit.

Documentaries.title: Noma My Perfect Storm
Documentaries.description: Creative genius René Redzepi is renowned as one of the world’s best chefs. His restaurant Noma was voted best restaurant in the world four times.

Documentaries.title: Nothing Is Truer Than Truth
Documentaries.description: Nothing Is Truer than Truth introduces Edward de Vere, A-list party boy on the continental circuit, who travels to Venice in 1575 and becomes Shakespeare. The film argues that the author’s bisexuality is the reason for the pseudonym.

Documentaries.title: Obey Giant
Documentaries.description: A documentary that profiles the life and work of artist Shepard Fairey, following his roots in punk rock and skateboarding to his creation of the iconic Obama HOPE poster and the controversy that surrounds it.

Documentaries.title: Off Label
Documentaries.description: A probing exposé of an over medicated, misdiagnosed, and drug-addled America, OFF LABEL takes us on an emotional journey through 8 uniquely personal experiences to shed light on an unknown and often camouflaged plague affecting our nation.

Documentaries.title: The Other F Word
Documentaries.description: Oscilloscope Laboratories presents a revealing and touching look at what happens when a generation's ultimate anti-authoritarians - punk rockers -become society's ultimate authorities - dads. Featuring Blink-182, Everclear, Pennywise. (234)

Documentaries.title: The Panama Papers
Documentaries.description: Director Alex Winter goes inside the biggest global corruption scandal in history that was uncovered by hundreds of journalists, working in secret and at enormous risk.

Documentaries.title: Passage to Mars
Documentaries.description: Incredible true story of a NASA arctic expedition designed to be the first Martian road trip on Earth becomes an epic two-year odyssey of survival. Voiceover from Buzz Aldrin.

Documentaries.title: Pick of the Litter
Documentaries.description: Five spirited Labrador puppies embark on an incredible journey to become guide dogs for the blind. Which ones will have what it takes?

Documentaries.title: Public Figure
Documentaries.description: A documentary that investigates the psychological effects of everyday social media use while exploring how our influencers deal with the fame, money, hate, and obsession that comes with it.

Documentaries.title: The Push
Documentaries.description: Two years after a debilitating accident, Grant Korgan becomes the first spinal cord injured athlete to actually push himself 100 miles to the geographic South Pole.

Documentaries.title: Queen Collective: Ballet After Dark
Documentaries.description: After surviving a violent attack, Tyde-Courtney Edwards founds a group for survivors of sexual abuse and domestic violence. From Queen Latifah, Tribeca, and P&G, the Queen Collective is a program accelerating gender and racial equality behind the camera.

Documentaries.title: Queen Collective: If There Is Light
Documentaries.description: Fourteen year-old Janiyah wrestles with her life in New York as her mom tries to move her family out of the shelter system. From Queen Latifah, Tribeca, and P&G, the Queen Collective is a program accelerating gender and racial equality behind the camera.

Documentaries.title: The Quest of Alain Ducasse
Documentaries.description: Alain Ducasse is one of the world’s most renowned chefs and culinary mentors. He tirelessly travels the world smelling, tasting, touching and fearlessly creating ground-breaking new cuisine. French, subtitled in English.

Documentaries.title: The Quiet One
Documentaries.description: He was the bassist for The Rolling Stones and known as the "quiet one." Now, Bill Wyman speaks out about life in the world’s greatest rock band through a tour of his personal archive.

Documentaries.title: Raise Hell: The Life and Times of Molly Ivins
Documentaries.description: Raise Hell: The Life and Times of Molly Ivins tells the story of media firebrand Molly Ivins, six feet of Texas trouble who took on the Good Old Boy corruption wherever she found it.

Documentaries.title: Ramen Heads
Documentaries.description: Japan's king of ramen opens his kitchen and five other prestige ramen shops to share recipes and trade secrets in this savory homage to noodles and broth.

Documentaries.title: RBG
Documentaries.description: An intimate portrait of an unlikely rock star: Justice Ruth Bader Ginsburg. With unprecedented access, the filmmakers explore how her early legal battles changed the world for women.

Documentaries.title: The Reagan Show
Documentaries.description: Told solely through archival footage and set against the backdrop of the Cold War, The Reagan Show presents the pageantry, absurdity, and charisma of a prolific actor’s defining role: Leader of the Free World.

Documentaries.title: The Reckoning
Documentaries.description: Powerful, personal and uncensored, The Reckoning explores the most explosive scandal in pop culture’s history: sexual misconduct in Hollywood.

Documentaries.title: The Riot and the Dance: Earth
Documentaries.description: Join in the glorious uproar of creation with Dr. Gordon Wilson as he traverses the planet, basking in God’s masterpieces found throughout the animal kingdom.

Documentaries.title: Roller Dreams
Documentaries.description: It's 1984 and Venice Beach, CA, is at the epicenter of a pop culture explosion. Young people of color seeking refuge from the turmoil of inner city life flock to the eclectic ocean community to create a brand new phenomenon: roller dancing!

Documentaries.title: Saving Jaws
Documentaries.description: Biologist OCEAN RAMSEY (“Shark Whisper") credits her connection with sharks to years of research, but others feel it’s something more. Join Ocean and a team of biologists as they travel the globe trying to halt their looming extinction.

Documentaries.title: School Life
Documentaries.description: This documentary follows a year in the lives of two inspirational teachers at the only primary-age boarding school in Ireland. For nearly half a century they have shaped thousands of minds, but the unthinkable looms: what would retirement mean?

Documentaries.title: Scotch: A Golden Dream
Documentaries.description: For more than a century, Scotch whisky has been the premier international spirit of choice. With a backdrop of stunning Scottish landscapes, explore the artistic and scientific building blocks of making whisky; the stuff dreams are made of.

Documentaries.title: Sea of Shadows
Documentaries.description: Sea of Shadows uncovers a black market that threatens the extinction of the vaquita.

Documentaries.title: Seymour: An Introduction
