Documentaries.description: Meet Seymour Bernstein: a virtuoso pianist, veteran New Yorker, and true original who gave up a successful concert career to teach music.

Documentaries.title: Sharp Edges
Documentaries.description: Sharp Edges is an intimate look into the early years of figure skater, Tonya Harding. Featuring early interviews with Tonya, as well as her coaches and mother (portrayed by Oscar (R)-winning Allison Janney in I, TONYA).

Documentaries.title: Shut Up and Play the Hits
Documentaries.description: LCD final show at MSG: frontman James Murphy had made the conscious decision to disband one of the most celebrated and influential bands of its generation at the peak of its popularity, ensuring that the band would go out on top.

Documentaries.title: Sneakerheadz
Documentaries.description: An in-depth look into the exploding subculture of sneaker collecting and the widespread influence it has had on popular culture around the world.

Documentaries.title: Somm
Documentaries.description: The story of four sommeliers attempting to pass the prestigious Master Sommelier exam, a test with one of the lowest pass rates in the world.

Documentaries.title: Somm 3
Documentaries.description: Three of the greatest legends in wine meet to drink the rarest bottles of their careers, while the best blind tasters of today gather to settle an age-old argument. The results could change the world of wine forever.

Documentaries.title: Somm: Into The Bottle
Documentaries.description: The seldom seen world that surrounds the wine we drink. How is it grown? What goes on in the cellar? This is a never before seen look into the world of wine.

Documentaries.title: Soul Boys of the Western World
Documentaries.description: Relive the music, fashion, and spirit of the 80s via the incredible, behind-the-scenes saga of the rise, fall, and comeback of chart-topping New Wave legends Spandau Ballet.

Documentaries.title: Soul of a Banquet
Documentaries.description: In this mouth-watering documentary, director Wayne Wang (The Joy Luck Club) profiles Cecilia Chiang, the matriarch of modern Chinese cooking, as she relates her fascinating history and cooks up a sumptuous, once-in-a-lifetime banquet.

Documentaries.title: Standing in the Shadows of Motown
Documentaries.description: In 1959, Berry Gordy Jr. gathered the best musicians from Detroit's thriving jazz and blues scene to begin cutting songs for his new record company - Motown. This documentary tells the unforgettable story of the Funk Brothers.

Documentaries.title: Steve Jobs: The Man in the Machine
Documentaries.description: Academy Award®-winning director Alex Gibney [Going Clear: Scientology and the Prison of Belief] pulls no punches in his portrait of Apple founder Steve Jobs and his legacy.

Documentaries.title: Take Every Wave: The Life of Laird Hamilton
Documentaries.description: Experience the white-knuckle thrill of big wave surfing through the eyes of Laird Hamilton, a living legend who conquers the world's mightiest tides.

Documentaries.title: Take My Nose... Please!
Documentaries.description: Two comedians, Emily Askin and Jackie Hoffman, debate the merits and pitfalls of plastic surgery as they deliberate about going under the knife.

Documentaries.title: Tea With the Dames
Documentaries.description: Spend a delightfully bawdy afternoon with 4 legends of British stage & cinema. Dames Maggie Smith, Judi Dench, Eileen Atkins, and Joan Plowright spill the tea on life, love, and art.

Documentaries.title: Tell Them Anything You Want: A Portrait of Maurice Sendak
Documentaries.description: A loving look at one of the most cherished and controversial figures in children's literature. In this deeply moving tribute to Sendak, Lance Bangs and Spike Jonze (acclaimed director of WHERE THE WILD THINGS ARE) bring you a portrait of the seminal talent whose conficts with success and lifelong obsession with death have subtly influenced his work.

Documentaries.title: That Summer
Documentaries.description: Welcome to GREY GARDENS...as you've never seen it before. Discover the long-lost film featuring Big and Little Edie before they were cultural icons. With Andy Warhol.

Documentaries.title: This One's for the Ladies
Documentaries.description: Every Thursday night, hundreds of women gather for a potluck celebration and the chance to throw singles at the hottest dancers in New Jersey. This One's for the Ladies isn't just about  dancing, it's a heartwarming story of friendship and community.

Documentaries.title: Three Days of Glory
Documentaries.description: Three Days of Glory takes you behind the scenes for one of the most legendary celebrations in the world of wine during a year when the humble winemaker-farmers of Burgundy faced the most difficult season on record.

Documentaries.title: Three Identical Strangers
Documentaries.description: Identical triplets become separated at birth and adopted by three different families. Years later, their amazing reunion becomes a global sensation but also unearths an unimaginable secret that has radical repercussions.

Documentaries.title: Tickled
Documentaries.description: In this shocking documentary you have to see to believe, a pop-culture journalist investigates 'competitive endurance tickling.'

Documentaries.title: Tiny Shoulders: Rethinking Barbie
Documentaries.description: In her 59 years, Barbie has become a fashion icon, a lightning rod, and a target for feminists. Tiny Shoulders: Rethinking Barbie, featuring newly discovered footage and unprecedented access to the inner workings of a toy giant during Barbie’s biggest reinvention, surveys 60 years of women in popular culture through the lens of this 11.5 inch, Zelig-like plastic icon. Featuring interviews with Gloria Steinem, Roxane Gay, Peggy Orenstein, Mattel insiders and cultural historians, the documentary reveals, through both funny and crushing archival material, and fly-on-the-wall observations of Barbie’s current architects, the progression and regression in women’s fight for equality.

Documentaries.title: Toni Morrison: The Pieces I Am
Documentaries.description: This artful and intimate meditation on legendary storyteller Toni Morrison examines her life, her work and the powerful themes she has confronted throughout her literary career.

Documentaries.title: Too Funny to Fail: The Life & Death of The Dana Carvey Show
Documentaries.description: Why did "The Dana Carvey Show," with a writer’s room and cast including then unknowns Steve Carell, Stephen Colbert, Robert Smigel, and more, flop so spectacularly? "Too Funny to Fail" tells the true story of genius misfits who set out to make comedy history.

Documentaries.title: Transgender Nation
Documentaries.description: Gender identification is changing rapidly, causing heated division between the left and the right. Transgender Nation lifts the veil on the world of the Transgender and explore the secrets of a world most misunderstand.

Documentaries.title: Two Trains Runnin'
Documentaries.description: Two Trains Runnin' is about the search for two forgotten blues singers, set in Mississippi during the height of the civil rights movement. Directed by Sam Pollard, narrated by Common, and featuring the music of Gary Clark Jr.

Documentaries.title: ULAM: Main Dish
Documentaries.description: In this delicious documentary, Filipino-American filmmaker Alexandra Cuerdo answers this question -- and follows the rise of the Filipino food movement via the chefs crossing over to the center of the American table.

Documentaries.title: Unbanned: The Legend of AJ1
Documentaries.description: Unbanned explores the dynamic life of AJ1 from its unlikely origins to its role in disrupting NBA rules, birthing sneaker culture, and influencing a social and cultural revolution. This is the story of a shoe that changed the world.

Documentaries.title: An Unreasonable Man
Documentaries.description: Ralph Nader: preeminent liberal, consumer advocate, election spoiler. This Sundance festival gem explores the meaning of democracy and idealism in today's world.

Documentaries.title: Untouchable
Documentaries.description: The inside story of the rise and fall of Harvey Weinstein reveals how, over decades, he acquires and protects his power even as scandal threatens to engulf him.

Documentaries.title: Waiting for Superman
Documentaries.description: The compelling stories of five unforgettable students such as Emily, a Silicon Valley eighth-grader who is afraid of being labeled as unfit for college and Francisco, a Bronx first-grader whose mom will do anything to give him a better life.

Documentaries.title: Walk Away Renee
Documentaries.description: A sweet and affecting film about filmmaker Jonathan Caouette's journey of self-discovery on a transformative road trip with his mother.

Documentaries.title: We Are Columbine
Documentaries.description: On April 20, 1999, Columbine High School in Littleton, Colorado experienced one of the most deadly school shootings in United States history. The incident shocked a country that could scarcely imagine the epidemic of teen violence it foreshadowed.

Documentaries.title: Whitney
Documentaries.description: From Oscar®-winning filmmaker Kevin Macdonald comes an intimate, unflinching portrait of Whitney Houston and her family that probes beyond familiar tabloid headlines and sheds new light on the spellbinding trajectory of Houston’s life.

Documentaries.title: Who F***ed up the Internet?!
Documentaries.description: A hilarious look at a topic that effects all of our lives - net neutrality.

Documentaries.title: Whose Streets?
Documentaries.description: Told by the activists and leaders who live and breathe this movement for justice, Whose Streets? is an unflinching look at the Ferguson uprising. When unarmed teenager Michael Brown is killed by police and left lying in the street for hours, it marks a breaking point for the residents of St. Louis, Missouri. Grief, long-standing racial tensions and renewed anger bring residents together to hold vigil and protest this latest tragedy. Empowered parents, artists, and teachers from around the country come together as freedom fighters. As the National Guard descends on Ferguson with military grade weaponry, these young community members become the torchbearers of a new resistance. Filmmakers Sabaah Folayan and Damon Davis know this story because they are the story. Whose Streets? is a powerful battle cry from a generation fighting, not for their civil rights, but for the right to live.

Documentaries.title: The Wolfpack
Documentaries.description: The Wolfpack is a coming of age story following the six Angulo brothers who have spent their entire lives locked away from society in an apartment on the Lower East Side of Manhattan.

Documentaries.title: The Wrecking Crew
Documentaries.description: Music lovers will be astonished at the influence The Wrecking Crew wielded over rock and pop music in the 1960s and early 1970s. These unsung instrumentalists were the de-facto backing band on hit records by The Beach Boys, Phil Spector, Frank Sinatra, Nancy Sinatra, Sonny & Cher, Elvis, The Monkees and many more. These dedicated musicians brought the flair and musicianship that made the American “West Coast Sound” a dominant cultural force around the world.

Documentaries.title: Wrinkles the Clown
Documentaries.description: It started with a YouTube video: a sleeping child, oblivious to the clown slowly emerging from under her bed. Soon, more mysterious videos surfaced. Wrinkles The Clown explores the internet phenomenon and the hysteria it inspired.

Documentaries.title: You Laugh But It's True
Documentaries.description: In the world of stand-up comedy in South Africa, Trevor Noah uses his experiences during Apartheid to prepare for the biggest show of his life.

Documentaries.title: Zero Days
Documentaries.description: Documentary that explores the phenomena of a famed computer virus.

Drama.title: (Dub) Grave of the Fireflies
Drama.description: In the final months of World War II, 14-year-old Seita and his sister Setsuko are orphaned. With no surviving relatives and their emergency rations depleted, they struggle to survive in this heartbreaking story detailing the true casualties of war.

Drama.title: (Sub) Fairy Tail the Movie: Phoenix Priestess
Drama.description: Natsu and his mighty team of mages face evil rising from the embers in this action-packed feature-length exclusive! When a prince seeking immortality unleashes an ancient force, a raging war becomes the fiercest inferno the wizards have ever faced!

Drama.title: (Sub) Grave of the Fireflies
Drama.description: In the final months of World War II, 14-year-old Seita and his sister Setsuko are orphaned. With no surviving relatives and their emergency rations depleted, they struggle to survive in this heartbreaking story detailing the true casualties of war.

Drama.title: The 12th Man
Drama.description: Nazis hunt for a lone surviving saboteur in this edge-of-your-seat WWII thriller based on a true-life story. Jonathan Rhys-Meyers stars.

Drama.title: 24 Hour Love
Drama.description: Seven people (Lynn Whitfield, Darius McCrary, Angell Conwell) experience laughter, life and matters of the heart.

Drama.title: 28 Days Later
Drama.description: A deadly virus transforms humans into bloodthirsty, rage-filled zombies that leave a handful of survivors on the run for their lives.

Drama.title: 28 Hotel Rooms
Drama.description: On a business trip a married woman and a novelist have a 1 night stand.  Their affair turns into a relationship when they run into each other a year later.

Drama.title: A 2nd Chance
Drama.description: A young girl and her coach overcome adversity to make their way into the National Gymnastics Competition.

Drama.title: 4 Lovers
Drama.description: In this sexy, French romantic drama, two couples decide to explore the boundaries of their relationships by swapping partners.
Joseph Gordon-Levitt and Seth Rogen team up to beat the odds in a film that Peter Travers ofRolling Stone calls "achingly hilarious and heartfelt."

Drama.title: 6 Below: Miracle on the Mountain
Drama.description: When a snowstorm strands former professional hockey player Eric LeMarque (Josh Hartnett) atop the Sierra Nevada Mountains for eight days, he is forced to face his past and come to terms with his personal demons and rediscover the power of faith within him in order to survive.

Drama.title: Accomplices
Drama.description: A dangerous affair between two sexy teens turns deadly when they enter a world of kinky love and sordid prostitution.

Drama.title: Acrimony
Drama.description: In Tyler Perry's sexy and electrifying thriller, a faithful wife (Taraji. P. Henson) is driven over the edge when it becomes clear she has been betrayed.

Drama.title: Affairs of State
Drama.description: A young DC aide kickstarts his government career by sleeping with powerful women. But after seducing a candidate's daughter, he learns the game of politics can be a deadly one.

Drama.title: After Darkness
Drama.description: Natalia Dyer ("Stranger Things") and Kyra Sedgwick ("The Closer") highlight this apocalyptic sci-fi thriller about a family's fight to survive a solar disaster.

Drama.title: Air Strike
Drama.description: Starring Bruce Willis and Adrien Brody and featuring thrilling dogfight action, this intense epic portrays China's brave battle to stop the Japanese bomber strikes of WWII.

Drama.title: All About E
Drama.description: A sexy young DJ, E, and her gay best friend, Matt, are forced to run when E stumbles on some cash. But E finds she has burnt too many bridges and there is nowhere to run but outback Australia into the arms of the ex-girlfriend, Trish, who broke her heart.

Drama.title: Allure
Drama.description: Although Laura works as a house cleaner for her father's company, her personal life is not so pristine. Rough around the edges, looking for love in all the wrong places, her behavior points to hardships of the past. One day Laura meets Eva, a quiet teenager who is unhappy with her disciplined life. In Eva, Laura rediscovers an innocent tenderness. In Laura, Eva finds a thrilling rebel who can bring her into unknown territories. Their mutual attraction soon morphs into obsession.

Drama.title: Along Came the Devil
Drama.description: Ashley (Sydney Sweeney, “The Handmaid’s Tale”) contacts the spirit world to speak to her dead mother and unknowingly unearths a demonic force.

Drama.title: Along With the Gods: The Two Worlds
Drama.description: In this action-packed fantasy epic, a firefighter is taken to the afterlife by three guardians, where only after passing seven trials and proving he lived a noble life will he be able to reincarnate.

Drama.title: Alright Now
Drama.description: ALRIGHT NOW follows a rock musician (Cobie Smulders, “How I Met Your Mother”) who drunkenly enrolls in college after she breaks up with her boyfriend and her rock band falls apart....what could go wrong?

Drama.title: American Buffalo
Drama.description: A pair of crooks and their young intern plot the theft of a valuable Buffalo-head nickel. Based on a 1975 play by David Mamet.

Drama.title: American Folk
Drama.description: Two strangers, both musicians, are grounded in California in the aftermath of 9/11 and embark on a hopeful, cross-country road trip set to a soundtrack of classic folk.

Drama.title: American Gun
Drama.description: A series of interwoven story lines brings to light how the proliferation of guns in America dramatically influence and shape every day lives.

Drama.title: American Venus
Drama.description: Jenna Lane (Jane McGregor) is a young woman trying to escape family pressure to become an Olympic athlete and define her own individuality. Her mother is Celia (Rebecca De Mornay), a deeply disturbed, emotionally abusive woman with a thing for handguns. As she attempts to manipulate Jenna and feed her addictions, Celia grows increasingly irrational and ultimately spirals out of control.

Drama.title: Anchor and Hope
Drama.description: A lesbian couple, living a simple life, decide to have a child. A comedy starring Oona Chaplin and her mother Geraldine Chaplin.

Drama.title: And So It Goes
Drama.description: A self-absorbed realtor enlists the help of his neighbor when he's suddenly left in charge of the granddaughter he never knew existed until his estranged son drops her off at his home.

Drama.title: Anesthesia
Drama.description: Kristen Stewart & Sam Waterston lead a great ensemble cast in this provocative drama about a shocking crime on a snowy New York night that changes one man's life forever.

Drama.title: Angel of Mine
Drama.description: In this intense thriller, Noomi Rapace stars as a woman on the edge who believes the daughter of a neighbor is actually her own.

Drama.title: Angel of Mine
Drama.description: Elsa is fighting to keep custody of her son Thomas. One day while picking her son up from a birthday party, she notices a 6 year-old girl. Immediately, Elsa is convinced the girl is the daughter she lost in a hospital fire and becomes fixated on finding her again. Obsessed by this uncontrollable feeling, she manipulatively inches her way into the girl's life. The girl's mother progressively finds Elsa's behavior disturbing to the point of insisting that she stop intruding in their lives. Elsa, seemingly crazy, challenges the girl's mother by asking for DNA tests. The rivalry between the two women begins. A psychological face-off between two women who should never have met.

Drama.title: Angels in the Snow
Drama.description: The dysfunctional Montgomery family go to their cabin for Christmas where a blizzard traps them inside. When the Tucker family arrives needing shelter, they are welcomed inside and remind the Montgomery family how to love each other.

Drama.title: Aniara
Drama.description: A spaceship carrying settlers to Mars is knocked off course, causing the consumption-obsessed passengers to consider their place in the universe.

Drama.title: Animals
Drama.description: A young couple addicted to heroin must confront the difficult truth.

Drama.title: Annihilation
Drama.description: A biologist signs up for a dangerous, secret expedition where the laws of nature don't apply.

Drama.title: Anthropoid
Drama.description: Based  on the extraordinary true story of Operation Anthropoid, the WWII mission to assassinate SS General Reinhard Heydrich, the main architect behind the Final Solution and the Reich’s third in command after Hitler and Himmler.

Drama.title: Arbitrage
Drama.description: Richard Gere leads an all-star cast in an electrifying thriller about a hedge-fund magnate whose fortunes turn when a deadly error threatens to destroy both his financial empire and his family.

Drama.title: Astronaut
Drama.description: One old man, one last dream - one golden ticket to the stars.

Drama.title: AWOL
Drama.description: Joey joins the Army as a way out of Pennsylvania coal country just as she falls in love with magnetic housewife Rayna. A splendid meditation on the boundless possibilities of first love constricted by the trials of poverty.

Drama.title: Back to Christmas
Drama.description: Ali wakes realizing she's reliving a past Christmas allowing her to change the path of her love life with her ex or with someone entirely unexpected!

Drama.title: Bad Company
Drama.description: Adventurous tale of two young drifters who wildly rob their way West during the Civil War.

Drama.title: Bare
Drama.description: An innocent young girl in a small Nevada town falls in love with a female drifter who leads her into a life of stripping, drugs, and psychedelic spiritual experiences.

Drama.title: Barefoot
Drama.description: The "black sheep" son of a wealthy family meets a young psychiatric patient who's been raised in isolation her entire life. He takes the woman home for his brother's wedding to convince his family that he's changed his life.

Drama.title: Beach Rats
Drama.description: BEACH RATS follows a teenage Frankie (Harris Dickinson) on the outer edges of Brooklyn as he struggles to reconcile his competing sexual desires, leaving him hurtling towards irreparable consequences.

Drama.title: Before I Go to Sleep
Drama.description: A woman wakes up every day, remembering nothing as a result of a traumatic accident in her past. One day, new terrifying truths emerge that force her to question everyone around her.

Drama.title: Ben Is Back
Drama.description: Holly (Julia Roberts) is swept into a race against time after her 19-year old son (Lucas Hedges) returns home for Christmas – and suddenly disappears.

Drama.title: Benjamin
Drama.description: A family calls in an intervention for Benjamin, their teenage son whom they believe to be hooked on crystal meth. Soon, it becomes clear that those who are confronting Benjamin's problem also have many problems of their own.

Drama.title: Bernie the Dolphin
Drama.description: In this heartwarming family adventure, the search for a missing dolphin leads two kids to uncover a real-estate development plan that endangers the sea life on a Florida beach.

Drama.title: Beyond Paradise
Drama.description: Shahrzad, a talented music student, flees Iran and agrees to marry a man in Los Angeles. Her new life is quickly threatened by a passionate relationship with her piano teacher's gardener.

Drama.title: Big Fish
Drama.description: Tim Burton's delightful fantasy about a young man trying to understand his dying father whose life is defined by the tall stories he tells.

Drama.title: Black Cop
Drama.description: A police officer is pushed to the edge after being profiled and assaulted by his colleagues, setting him on a skewed mission of vengeance on the privileged. A satire on police, social media and racial tension

Drama.title: Blind
Drama.description: A bestselling novelist (Alec Baldwin) loses his sight in a vicious car crash. Five years later, a Socialite (Demi Moore) is forced to read to the novelist as a plea bargain for her husband's insider trading. A passionate affair ensues.

Drama.title: Blood Diamond
Drama.description: Leonardo DiCaprio stars in this action drama as Danny Archer, a mercenary smuggler searching for a priceless diamond amid the chaos of Sierra Leone's civil war

Drama.title: Bolden
Drama.description: BOLDEN imagines the compelling, powerful and tragic journey of Buddy Bolden, the unsung American hero who invented Jazz.

Drama.title: The Bookshop
Drama.description: Free-spirited widow Florence Green risks everything to open a bookshop in a conservative East Anglian coastal town. While bringing about a surprising cultural awakening through works by Ray Bradbury and Vladimir Nabokov.

Drama.title: The Boost
Drama.description: A real estate developer who enjoyed short-lived success seeks to regain his edge by using cocaine, but takes himself to new lows as he gets lost in the downward spiral of drug addiction.

Drama.title: Borg vs McEnroe
Drama.description: It's the summer of 1980, and Björn Borg is the top tennis player in the world, dominating the sport both on and off the court. A powerful and rigorously disciplined player, there is only one obstacle in his pursuit of a record-breaking fifth Wimbledon championship: the highly talented but ferociously abrasive young American John McEnroe. With three days until the tournament begins, Borg trains religiously in his lavish Monaco home, aided by his coach and mentor Lennart and girlfriend Mariana.

Drama.title: BPM (Beats Per Minute)
Drama.description: Nathan is a young man who joins an AIDS activist group in 1990s Paris. As he attends the weekly meetings, he learns that some members prefer a more radical approach to their protests.

Drama.title: Breaking the Girls
Drama.description: As the friendship between 2 beautiful women deepens, they embark on a murderous pact that escalates beyond their control in a twisted tale of seduction and betrayal.

Drama.title: Brian Banks
Drama.description: An All-American football player's dreams to play in the NFL are halted when he is wrongly convicted and sent to prison. Years later, he fights to clear his name within an unjust system.

Drama.title: Bridget Jones's Diary
Drama.description: Bridget Jones (Renee Zellweger) begins keeping a diary that details her life as a single screwball and search for love in this hit comedy.

Drama.title: Bridget Jones: The Edge of Reason
Drama.description: Beloved screwball Bridget Jones (Renee Zellweger) struggles to make love last in this sequel with Hugh Grant and Colin Firth.

Drama.title: A Brilliant Young Mind
Drama.description: A socially awkward teenage math prodigy finds new confidence and new friendships when he lands a spot on the British squad at the International Mathematics Olympiad.

Drama.title: Buffalo '66
Drama.description: Billy is released after five years in prison. In the next moment, he kidnaps teenage student Layla and visits his parents with her, pretending she is his girlfriend and they will soon marry (and forcing her to say the same).

Drama.title: The Cage Fighter
Drama.description: A mixed martial arts competitor risks everything—his family, his marriage, even his life—to keep fighting in this riveting, true-life tale of resilience.

Drama.title: Cantinflas
Drama.description: Cantinflas is the untold story of Mexico's greatest and most beloved comedy film star of all time.

Drama.title: Captain Fantastic
Drama.description: A father raising his six kids in the Pacific Northwest is forced to leave.

Drama.title: Catching Faith
Drama.description: Alexa Taylor has a seemingly perfect life: Her daughter is an excellent student and her son is a star football player. But when things go wrong and friends turn their backs, Alexa learns that faith and family matters most.

Drama.title: Changeland
Drama.description: Directed by and starring Seth Green, the film follows two estranged best friends on a life-changing trip to Thailand. This epic journey reminds them that there's no problem that friendship and a few rounds in a Thai boxing ring can't fix.

Drama.title: The Childhood of a Leader
Drama.description: Robert Pattinson and Bérénice Bejo lead a powerhouse cast in this dark coming-of-age story in which a Hitler-esque dictator is born amid the rising tide of fascism.

Drama.title: Christmas Belle
Drama.description: It's "Beauty and the Beast" for Christmas when auctioneer Belle goes to catalog and finalize Hunter's estate sale. Hunter begins to soften as they work together, though, putting both the estate sale and Belle's heart in jeopardy.

Drama.title: The Christmas Calendar
Drama.description: When Emily, a small town baker, receives a Christmas Calendar from a secret admirer, it attracts the attention of the locals. With financial problems looming, the calendar turns out to be a Christmas miracle for Emily and the bakery.

Drama.title: Christmas Perfection
Drama.description: A woman magically wakes up in her perfect Christmas village in Ireland.

Drama.title: A Ciambra
Drama.description: A teenage boy must grow up fast to survive life on the margins of Southern Italy in this bracing work of raw realism from executive producer Martin Scorsese.

Drama.title: The Cleanse
Drama.description: A heartbroken man attending a spiritual retreat discovers the regimen releases more than toxins.

Drama.title: Coffin Rock
Drama.description: A married woman's careless one-night-stand becomes a nightmare when her lover ruthlessly stalks her family, in this edge-of-your-seat thriller.

Drama.title: The Cokeville Miracle
Drama.description: Children who were held hostage in their elementary school tell stories of miraculous things, but many adults are skeptical that the Cokeville Miracle ever truly happened.

Drama.title: The Commune
Drama.description: From Oscar-nominated director Thomas Vinterberg (The Celebration, The Hunt), comes a funny and moving story of family and free love set in a freewheeling 1970s commune. Danish with English subtitles.

Drama.title: The Conspirator
Drama.description: Abraham Lincoln's assassination is viewed from the perspective of the lone female conspirator charged in the case.

Drama.title: The Cookout
Drama.description: A raucous backyard cookout riles snooty residents in a gated community.

Drama.title: The Cooler
Drama.description: A Las Vegas casino employee who is paid to pass his bad luck onto streaking gamblers goes on a roll thanks to a pretty cocktail waitress.

Drama.title: The Counterfeit Traitor
Drama.description: There's no way out for American-raised Swede Eric Erickson. Either he becomes an Allied spy, or he faces a trumped-up charge of Nazi collaboration. "How does one get to be so cold-blooded?"

Drama.title: Cover Versions
Drama.description: Four band members tell varying accounts of a night of sex, drugs, and murder before their first big show at a popular music festival.

Drama.title: Creed II
Drama.description: Life has become a balancing act for Adonis Creed (Michael B. Jordan). Between personal obligations and training for his next fight, he is up against the challenge of his life

Drama.title: A Crooked Somebody
Drama.description: Michael Vaughn, a phony psychic medium, is kidnapped by a guilt-ridden murderer who believes Michael can help him make peace with the spirit of his dead victim.

Drama.title: Cruise
Drama.description: Set in the 1980s, a young Italian-American from the "wrong side of the tracks" falls for a Jewish girl from Long Island.

Drama.title: Crypto
Drama.description: In this cyber-thriller starring Kurt Russell and Beau Knapp, a Wall Street banker connects a small-town art gallery to a global conspiracy, putting his own family in grave danger.

Drama.title: Dans Paris
Drama.description: Depression has never looked so hip as it does in this Parisian youth pic, about two brothers: one goes through a breakup, the other on a tour of women's bedrooms.

Drama.title: Dark Shadows: The Haunting of Collinwood
Drama.description: Barnabas Collins and Dr. Julia Hoffman attempt to uncover the mysterious happenings at the haunted Collinwood estate when the children become possessed by an evil spirit.

Drama.title: Dark Shadows: The Vampire Curse
Drama.description: Cursed by the scorned witch Angelique, Barnabas Collins rises from the dead as a vampire. He seeks to reclaim his true love and save his family from further destruction.

Drama.title: Deck the Halls
Drama.description: Based on the first book in Mary Higgins Clark and daughter Carol Higgins Clark's novels, this story brings together two of the authors' most popular characters: Cleaning-woman-turned-private-eye Alvirah, and Detective Reilly.

Drama.title: Deck the Halls
Drama.description: Holly (Gabrielle Carteris, Beverly Hills, 90210) returns to her hometown with her eight-year old son, Ben, to work for her father's toy business. Soon after, Ben watches a man (Steve Bacic, Big Love) move in next door with a sleigh, red suit, and lots of Christmas goodies. Ben begins to believe that their new neighbor is Santa Claus, and devises a plan to set up his mom with Santa Claus.

Drama.title: The Den
Drama.description: After receiving a grant for her graduate thesis, Elizabeth Benton (Melanie Papalia) logs onto a video-chat site known as The Den, on a mission to explore the habits of its users.  During one of her random video-chats, Elizabeth watches in horror as a teenage girl is gruesomely murdered in front of her webcam. While the police dismiss it as a viral prank, Elizabeth believes what she saw is real and takes it upon herself to find the truth.  Her life quickly spirals out of control as she gets pulled deeper into the darkest recesses of the internet.  And eventually, Elizabeth finds herself trapped in a twisted game in which she and her loved ones are targeted for the same grisly fate as the first victim.

Drama.title: Denial
Drama.description: A historian must battle for historical truth when she is sued for libel.

Drama.title: Dept Q: The Keeper of Lost Causes
Drama.description: Police inspector Carl Morck and his assistant investigate a cold case involving a missing woman.

Drama.title: Dept. Q: A Conspiracy of Faith
Drama.description: Department Q goes on the hunt for a serial killer when a desperate message, written in blood by two children, is found 14 years after they were kidnapped.

Drama.title: Dept. Q: The Absent One
Drama.description: The brutal, 20-year-old murder of a pair of twins is double the trouble for the detectives of Department Q in this gripping second installment in the blockbuster crime series.

Drama.title: Destiny Turns on the Radio
Drama.description: Johnny Destiny burns into Las Vegas in his hot Dodge RoadRunner, stopping only to pick up a stranger stranded in the desert. But then, things aren't always as they seem.

Drama.title: Destroyer
Drama.description: Destroyer is a gritty, riveting and complex crime thriller starring Oscar-winner Nicole Kidman in a virtuoso performance as a hardened detective worn down by the rigors of her job and the aftermath of an undercover FBI sting gone horribly wrong.

Drama.title: Detroit
Drama.description: From the Academy Award winning director of THE HURT LOCKER and ZERO DARK THIRTY, DETROIT tells the gripping story of one of the most terrifying moments during the civil unrest that rocked Detroit in the summer of '67.

Drama.title: Diane
Drama.description: Mary Kay Place is extraordinary as a woman coming to terms with her troubled past in this beautiful story of redemption.

Drama.title: Diary of a Hitman
Drama.description: A hired killer struggles with his conscience when asked to perform his last hit on a young woman and her baby.

Drama.title: Digging for Fire
Drama.description: The discovery of a bone and a rusty old gun send a husband and wife on separate adventures over the course of a weekend.

Drama.title: Dirty Wars
Drama.description: It's the dirty little secret of the War on Terror: all bets are off, and almost anything goes. We have fundamentally changed the rules of the game and the rules of engagement. Today drone strikes, night raids, and U.S. government–condoned torture occur in corners across the globe, generating unprecedented civilian casualties. Investigative reporter Jeremy Scahill (author of Blackwater: The Rise of the World's Most Mercenary Army) traces the rise of the Joint Special Operations Command, the most secret fighting force in U.S. history, exposing operations carried out by men who do not exist on paper and will never appear before Congress. No target is off-limits for the JSOC "kill list," even a U.S. citizen. Director Richard Rowley takes us on a chilling ride with whistle-blower Scahill. Dirty Wars is a battle cry for the soul and conscience of an America few of us know exists.

Drama.title: The Disappointments Room
Drama.description: A mother and her young son release unimaginable horrors from a hidden room in the attic of their rural dream home.

Drama.title: Disorder
Drama.description: Suffering from post-traumatic stress disorder, a security guard (Matthias Schoenaerts) utilizes his training as a French special forces soldier to protect the wife (Diane Kruger) and son (Zaïd Errougui-Demonsant) of a shady Lebanese businessman.

Drama.title: Dogman (2018)
Drama.description: Marcello is coerced into the petty criminal schemes of the local bully. When Simoncino’s abuse finally brings Marcello to a breaking point, he decides to stand up for his own dignity through an act of vengeance, with unintended consequences.

Drama.title: Don't Go
Drama.description: Between dreams and reality lies a terrifying hidden truth… A grieving father's nightmare holds the key to his daughter's death in this tantalizing psychological puzzle.

Drama.title: Downhill Racer
Drama.description: An ambitious American Skier gains a place on the team competing in Europe.

Drama.title: Downsizing
Drama.description: When scientists find a way to shrink humans to five inches tall, Paul Safranek and his wife Audrey decide to ditch their stressed out lives in order to get small and live large in a luxurious downsized community.

Drama.title: Drinking Buddies
Drama.description: Although they're both dating other people, two co-workers (Olivia Wilde, Jake Johnson) hang out together in bars and try to ignore their mutual attraction.

Drama.title: DriverX
Drama.description: Follow rideshare driver Leonard on a voyage through LA's late-night, temptation-filled party scene, where you never know who's going to get into your car next.

Drama.title: The Duchess of Langeais
Drama.description: Antoinette (Balibara) is the Duchess, a married coquette who frequents the most extravagant balls in 1820's Paris during The Restoration. Hypocrisy and vanity reign. Handsome general Armand de Montriveau (Guillaume Depardieu) feels true love upon first meeting the Duchess. Flattered, the alluring Antoinette orchestrates a calculated game of seduction, but repeatedly refuses the general. Despite his sincere romantic declarations, Montriveau's passion remains unfulfilled. When he eventually seeks revenge, Antoinette's love awakens. But it may well be too late for the star-crossed lovers.

Drama.title: The Duke of Burgundy
Drama.description: Sex, bondage, and butterflies: two women explore the extremes of carnal desire in this kinky, deliciously twisted tale of erotic obsession. In a crumbling European estate, butterfly researcher Cynthia (Sidse Babett Knudsen) and her lover Evelyn (Chiara D'Anna) repeatedly enact a sadomasochistic role-playing game, with Cynthia as the stern mistress and Evelyn her subservient sex slave. But as the lines between fantasy and reality begin to blur, and Cynthia grows increasingly uneasy with Evelyn’s insatiable appetite for punishment, their relationship is pushed to the limit. Dripping with dreamlike imagery, Gothic atmosphere, and a lush chamber pop score by Cat’s Eyes, this critically-acclaimed, darkly comic erotic fantasia is a seductive feast for the senses.

Drama.title: Earth Girls Are Easy
Drama.description: Three furry, colorful aliens crash-land in L.A. and are introduced to American pop culture by a ditsy manicurist.

Drama.title: Embrace of the Serpent
Drama.description: At once blistering and poetic, the ravages of colonialism cast a dark shadow over the South American landscape in EMBRACE OF THE SERPENT, the third feature by Ciro Guerra. Filmed in stunning black-and-white, SERPENT centers on Karamakate, an Amazonian shaman and the last survivor of his people, and the two scientists who, over the course of 40 years, build a friendship with him. The film was inspired by the real-life journals of two explorers (Theodor Koch-Grünberg and Richard Evans Schultes) who traveled through the Colombian Amazon during the last century in search of the sacred and difficult-to-find psychedelic Yakruna plant. 2016 Academy Award Nominee - Best Foreign Language Film

Drama.title: Errors of the Human Body
Drama.description: Haunted by a personal loss, a brilliant geneticist working on a top-secret project unwittingly unleashes a new virus in this intense sci-fi thriller.

Drama.title: The Escape
Drama.description: A struggling housewife sets out to reclaim her life in this stirring, emotionally rich look at what it means to become yourself. Gemma Arterton and Dominic Cooper star.

Drama.title: The Escort
Drama.description: Desperate for a good story, a sex-addicted journalist throws himself into the world of high-class escorts when he starts following a Stanford-educated prostitute.

Drama.title: Eve's Christmas
Drama.description: On Christmas Eve, a high-powered executive's guardian angel offers her a chance to live her life again with a different spin.

Drama.title: Every Day
Drama.description: "Every Day" tells the story of Rhiannon, a 16-year old girl who falls in love with a mysterious spirit named "A" that inhabits a different body every day.

Drama.title: Every Other Holiday
Drama.description: A young divorced mom takes her ex-husband home for the holidays to fulfill the one Christmas wish of her children, but finds herself caught between her protective mother and the ex she discovers she still loves.

Drama.title: Evolution
Drama.description: In this sci-fi thriller, a remote island is inhabited by young boys who are subjected to strange medical treatments. Soon one boy makes a disturbing discovery beneath the waves.

Drama.title: Experimenter
Drama.description: Yale University, 1961. Stanley Milgram (Peter Sarsgaard) designs a psychology experiment that remains relevant to this day, in which people think they’re delivering painful electric shocks to an affable stranger (Jim Gaffigan) strapped into a chair in another room. Disregarding his pleas for mercy, the majority of subjects do not stop the experiment, administering what they think are near-fatal electric shots, simply because they’ve been told to. Milgram’s exploration of authority and conformity strikes a nerve in popular culture and the scientific community. Celebrated in some circles, he is also accused of being a deceptive, manipulative monster. His wife Sasha (Winona Ryder) anchors him through it all.

Drama.title: Eyes of an Angel
Drama.description: Bobby Allen (John Travolta) is a small-time crook working as a bagman for the mob in Chicago. When circumstances force Bobby to turn against his brother-in-law, he realizes Chicago is no longer a safe place for him.

Drama.title: Eyes Wide Shut
Drama.description: Tom Cruise and Nicole Kidman star as a married couple entangled in an intricate web of jealousy and sexual obsession in Stanley Kubrick's final cinematic offering.

Drama.title: Fallen
Drama.description: Upon entering a mysterious reform school, Luce finds herself drawn into a love triangle and discovers her own love story that has been ongoing for centuries.

Drama.title: Fast Color
Drama.description: Hunted by mysterious forces and a local sheriff, a young woman with supernatural abilities flees back to her family-and unearths the depths of the power within her.

Drama.title: Fathers & Daughters
Drama.description: A Pulitzer-winning writer grapples with being a widower and father after a mental breakdown, while, 27 years later, his grown daughter struggles to forge connections of her own.

Drama.title: The Field Guide to Evil
Drama.description: This global anthology of eight narratives explores dark folklore through a series of myths and tales that have captivated, galvanized and frightened communities throughout history.

Drama.title: Fierce People
Drama.description: A massage therapist and her son move into the mansion of a wealthy client, but a shocking event changes their lives.

Drama.title: Fighting with My Family
Drama.description: Former wrestler Ricky makes a living performing with his family. When they get the chance to audition for WWE, the family's dream seems to be coming true.  However, they find out that becoming a WWE Superstar demands more than they ever imagined possible.

Drama.title: The Final Cut
Drama.description: In world with memory recording implants, Alan Hakman's job is to edit people's recorded histories. But his latest assignment puts him in grave danger.

Drama.title: Finding Your Feet
Drama.description: On the eve of retirement, a middle-class snob discovers her husband has been having an affair, and is forced to live with her bohemian sister on an impoverished inner-city estate.

Drama.title: First Girl I Loved
Drama.description: In this Sundance award-winner, high-school misfit Anne falls in love with Sasha, the beautiful star of the softball team. When Anne tells her best friend Clifton about her new crush, his jealousy threatens more than just the girls' budding romance.

Drama.title: Flight of the Red Balloon
Drama.description: A boy is followed by a mysterious balloon around Paris, a city that has never looked so beautiful as when shot by the world's most lauded director, Hou Hsiao Hsien.

Drama.title: Flower
Drama.description: A rebellious, quick-witted teenage girl (Zoey Deutch) living with her single mom (Kathryn Hahn) conspires with her troubled stepbrother to expose a high school teacher's (Adam Scott) dark secret.

Drama.title: For Colored Girls
Drama.description: Each of the women portray one of the characters represented in the collection of twenty poems, revealing different issues that impact women in general and women of color in particular.

Drama.title: Forever My Girl
Drama.description: A country music super-star returns to his hometown after leaving his love behind 8 years ago.

Drama.title: Foxfire
Drama.description: Four high school girls form a gang when an enigmatic 17-year-old female drifter comes to town. The girls learn about lesbianism, drug addiction and empowerment, all of which transforms them forever.

Drama.title: Freak Show
Drama.description: Billy Bloom is talented, fierce and fearless but does he have what it takes to win homecoming queen? Bette Midler, Abigail Breslin star in this fabulous comedy.

Drama.title: Free Willy
Drama.description: When maladjusted orphan Jesse (Jason James Richter) vandalizes a theme park, he is placed with foster parents and must work at the park to make amends. There he meets Willy, a young Orca whale who has been separated from his family. Sensing kinship, they form a bond and, with the help of kindly whale trainer Rae Lindley (Lori Petty), develop a routine of tricks. However, greedy park owner Dial (Michael Ironside) soon catches wind of the duo and makes plans to profit from them.

Drama.title: Free Willy 2: The Adventure Home
Drama.description: It's been two years since a brave 12-year-old boy rescued a majestic orca whale named Willy, but their reunion is marred when an oil spill threatens Willy's pod.

Drama.title: The French Connection
Drama.description: Gene Hackman stars in this 1971 Best Picture Oscar(R) winner about a maverick cop who stops a huge heroin shipment into New York.

Drama.title: The Frozen Ground
Drama.description: Inspired by the incredible true story that follows Alaskan State Trooper Jack Halcombe as he sets out to end the murderous rampage of Robert Hansen, a serial killer who has gone unnoticed for 13 years.

Drama.title: The Fugitive
Drama.description: Harrison Ford stars as a doctor accused of killing his wife who goes on the lam in search of the real culprit. Tommy Lee Jones co-stars.

Drama.title: The Furies
Drama.description: Western depicting the clash between a self-made cattle king of the Old West and his equally iron-willed daughter. Based on Niven Busch's novel.

Drama.title: Gangster No. 1
Drama.description: GANGSTER NO. 1 chronicles the rise and fall of a prominent and ruthless English gangster.

Drama.title: Gemini
Drama.description: A heinous crime tests the complex relationship between a Hollywood starlet and her tenacious personal assistant. As the assistant unravels the mystery, she must confront her own understanding of friendship, truth and celebrity.

Drama.title: The German Doctor
Drama.description: A German physician meets an Argentinean family who is gradually won over by his charisma, manners, knowledge and money—until they discover they are living with one of the most heinous criminals of all time.

Drama.title: Get Big
Drama.description: "Get Big" follows the misadventures of two friends, Alec and Nate, as they reconnect to attend a high school classmate's wedding.

Drama.title: Getting Go: The Go Doc Project
Drama.description: After becoming infatuated with a hunky New York go-go dancer, college boy Doc devises a plan to get close to his crush by asking him to be the main subject in a makeshift documentary.

Drama.title: Getting Grace
Drama.description: Grace, a teenage girl dying of cancer, crashes a funeral home to find out what will happen to her after she dies, but ends up teaching awkward funeral director Bill how to celebrate life.

Drama.title: Girl in Progress
Drama.description: Grace (Eva Mendes) is a single mom. She is too busy juggling work, bills, and the very married Dr. Hartford (Matthew Modine), to give her daughter, Ansiedad (Cierra Ramirez) the attention she desperately needs.

Drama.title: The Girl King
Drama.description: Sweden’s Queen Kristina, a flamboyant and unpredictable woman who ascended the throne at age six, was raised as a prince and strived to bring peace and education to her country—all while pursuing an illicit romance with her female royal attendant.

Drama.title: Girl Most Likely
Drama.description: Imogene is a failed New York playwright awkwardly navigating the transition from Next Big Thing to Last Year's News. After both her career and relationship hit the skids, she's forced to make the humiliating move back home.

Drama.title: The Girl Under the Waves
Drama.description: A man and a woman begin a romance when they mistakenly move into the same apartment. The film uses innovative techniques including actor improvised lines, long takes, title cards and on camera director interaction.

Drama.title: Golden Exits
Drama.description: An intersectional narrative of two families in Brooklyn and the unraveling of unspoken unhappiness that occurs when a young woman spending time abroad upsets the balance on both sides.

Drama.title: Golden Gate
Drama.description: Golden Gate is a stylish, compelling tale of mystery, intrigue and revenge! As a brash young F.B.I. agent comes to terms with his past, he unexpectedly falls in love with the beautiful daughter of a man he unjustly sent to prison years before!

Drama.title: Gone
Drama.description: The police don't believe her, so a woman (Amanda Seyfried) sets out alone to track the serial killer she escaped from in the past and who she now believes has abducted her sister.

Drama.title: The Good Guy
Drama.description: The girlfriend of a hotshot Wall Street trader finds herself falling for his protege.

Drama.title: Good Morning Killer
Drama.description: This thriller stars Catherine Bell as FBI Special Agent Ana Gray, an undercover operative tracking down a serial kidnapper. As Ana develops a rapport with the kidnapper's latest victim, the suspect suddenly changes his pattern.

Drama.title: Good Time Max
Drama.description: Not exactly cut out for a desk job, Max converts his co-workers into meth-heads and party hounds in this hilarious comedy from the tripped-out mind of James Franco.

Drama.title: Good Will Hunting
Drama.description: Robin Williams is a therapist who comes to the aid of a brilliant, but troubled Boston youth played by Matt Damon.

Drama.title: Goodbye First Love
Drama.description: Mia Hansen-Love returns with GOODBYE FIRST LOVE, an acutely perceptive portrait of a bright young woman in the wake of her first romance. Fifteen-year-old Camille (Lola Creton) is a serious girl who has fallen in love with the cheerful Sullivan (Sebastian Urzendowsky), an older boy who returns her feelings, mostly, but wants to be free to explore the world. When he leaves her to travel, she is devastated, but develops over the following years, into a more fully formed woman, with new interests and a new love - and the possibility that she'll be less defenseless when Sullivan enters her life again. Hansen-Love's follow up to the award-winning THE FATHER OF MY CHILDREN is filled with scenes that showcase her extraordinary ability to evoke moods and feelings. The story of a young woman's first romance is made into a singular experience, familiar in its broad strokes and yet so specific that it feels uniquely personal.

Drama.title: Gorky Park
Drama.description: An detective on the Moscow police force relentlessly pursues the killer of a triple homicide in Moscow's Gorky Park only to find his investigation uncovers a political conspiracy that no one wants exposed.

Drama.title: Grace Unplugged
Drama.description: Having just turned 18, Grace Trey (AJ Michalka) aspires to more than just singing at her church, where the worship leader is her father (James Denton), a former pop star.

Drama.title: Greater
Drama.description: Told he lacked the skills to play on his school's football team, University of Arkansas student Brandon Burlsworth made the team as a walk-on, eventually becoming a captain and star offensive lineman for the illustrious Arkansas Razorbacks.

Drama.title: Gridiron Gang
Drama.description: Dwayne "The Rock" Johnson (The Rundown, Walking Tall) stars in this gritty and inspirational movie, based on a true story about a group of teenage delinquents given a second chance to redeem themselves by playing football.

Drama.title: The Guilty
Drama.description: When a 911 dispatcher and former cop answers an emergency call from a kidnapped woman, he has to find a way to save her using just his phone and his wits in this pulse pounding, award-winning crime thriller. Danish, subtitled in English.

Drama.title: Hannie Caulder
Drama.description: A woman begins a lonely search for the bank robbers who murdered her husband.

Drama.title: Happy Accidents
Drama.description: A young woman finds love and happiness until her new boyfriend announces he is from the year 2470. Marisa Tomei and Vincent D'Onofrio star.

Drama.title: Haze
Drama.description: In the aftermath of a brutal hazing death, a college freshman's desire to join a fraternity is threatened when his older brother launches an anti-hazing crusade.

Drama.title: The Heart of Christmas
Drama.description: Megan (Candace Cameron Bure) re-examines her priorities after she sees people decorating for Christmas in October to help a family celebrate Christmas with their dying son.

Drama.title: Hearts Beat Loud
Drama.description: In Red Hook, Brooklyn, a father and daughter become an unlikely songwriting duo in the last summer before she leaves for college.

Drama.title: Heathers
Drama.description: Westerburg High School's elite clique of popular girls is "The Heathers," comprised of the powerful Heather Chandler, the green-with-envy Heather Duke, and the cowardly Heather McNamara. Rounding out the foursome is Veronica Sawyer (Winona Ryder), who is so fed up with the Heathers and the entire peer pressure cooker that she starts running with J.D. (Christian Slater), a mysterious - and possibly psychotic - motorcycle-riding newcomer. But what begins as their noble effort to rid Westerburg of its bad apples ends up taking a real toll. And their teen rebellion produces a serious and mounting body count. Shannen Doherty co-stars in this cruelly hilarious dark comedy, which became one of the biggest cult classics of the '80s.

Drama.title: Hector and the Search for Happiness
Drama.description: A psychiatrist searches the globe to find the secret of happiness.

Drama.title: Hello I Must Be Going
Drama.description: A divorcee (Melanie Lynskey) moves back in with her parents and begins a clandestine affair with a 19-year-old suitor (Christopher Abbott).

Drama.title: Henry Gamble's Birthday Party
Drama.description: Henry Gamble is turning 17 today. As Henry treads through various sexual possibilities trying to finally come into his own, so too do the adults and teenagers at the party.

Drama.title: The Hero
Drama.description: World-renowned icon Sam Elliott stars as an aging actor confronting mortality in THE HERO, a beautifully poignant celebration of life and the legacies we leave behind.  Also starring Laura Prepon, Nick Offerman, and Krysten Ritter.

Drama.title: Hide
Drama.description: In this movie based on Lisa Gardner's book, Carla Gugino plays Boston Police Detective D.D. Warren, who is called to the grounds of an abandoned mental hospital where a buried chamber is discovered.

Drama.title: High Strung
Drama.description: When a Midwest dancer and a street-wise British musician meet in New York, they immediately clash but there’s an undeniable attraction as well. The two must navigate their differences for a competition that will change their lives forever.

Drama.title: High-Rise
Drama.description: Tom Hiddleston stars as Dr. Robert Laing, the newest resident of a luxurious apartment in a high-tech skyscraper whose lofty location places him amongst society's upper class. Laing quickly settles in and meets the other tenants: Charlotte (Sienna Miller), a bohemian single mother; Wilder (Luke Evans), a charismatic documentarian who lives with his pregnant wife Helen (Elisabeth Moss); and Mr. Royal (Jeremy Irons), the buildings enigmatic architect. Life seems like paradise to the solitude-seeking Laing. But, as power outages become more frequent and building flaws emerge, mainly on the lower floors, social strata begins to crumble and the building descends into a class war.

Drama.title: His and Her Christmas
Drama.description: A chance meeting between rival newspaper journalists with rival Christmas columns is an epic disaster--and maybe love at first sight.

Drama.title: Hollow in the Land
Drama.description: When Alison's brother goes missing after being named the primary suspect in a trailer park murder, she must unearth the truth before her brother ends up behind bars or inside a casket. The harder she looks, the more people turn up dead.

Drama.title: Hornet's Nest
Drama.description: Robbie Amell, Michael Boatman and Michael Silver co-star in the first in this adaptation of the first novel in Cornwell's series of mysteries featuring reporter Andy Brazil, Police Chief Judy Hammer and her top deputy.

Drama.title: Hounds of Love
Drama.description: When Vicki Maloney is randomly abducted from a suburban street by a disturbed couple, she realizes she must drive a wedge between them if she is to survive.

Drama.title: The Housemaid
Drama.description: Eun-yi (Do-yeon Jeon), a poor Korean woman, takes a job as a domestic servant in the lavish home of Hoon Goh (Jung-jae Lee), a handsome businessman whose wife Hae-ra (Seo Woo) is pregnant. Under the tutelage of her new boss, longtime employee and familial confidant Byung-sik (Yeo-Jong Yun), Eun-yi quickly learns the ways of the house -- and that Hoon's word is law. But when Eun-yi allows Hoon to seduce her, the benefits of her new position become dwarfed by the consequences of her actions.

Drama.title: The Housemaid
Drama.description: A forbidden passion awakens vengeful spirits within a haunted mansion in this bloodcurdling, erotic tour-de-force.

Drama.title: How to Eat Fried Worms
Drama.description: On his first day at a new school, eleven-year-old Billy goes up against the school bully in a challenge that ends up with a total gross-out date...to eat 10 worms in one day!

Drama.title: Howl
Drama.description: James Franco delivers a career-defining performance as poet Allen Ginsberg. Through his search for personal and creative expression, Ginsberg writes HOWL, and must contend with attorney Jake Ehrlich (Jon Hamm) during HOWL'S bizarre obscenity trial.

Drama.title: The Hunchback of Notre Dame
Drama.description: In fifteenth century Paris, the brother of the archdeacon plots with the gypsy king to foment a peasant revolt. Meanwhile, a freakish hunchback falls in love with the gypsy queen.

Drama.title: Hungry Hearts
Drama.description: A new mother's increasingly unstable behavior threatens her relationship with her husband (Adam Driver) and the life of her infant.

Drama.title: Hunt for the Wilderpeople
Drama.description: Raised on hip-hop and foster care, defiant city kid Ricky gets a fresh start in the New Zealand countryside. He quickly finds himself at home with his new foster family: the loving Aunt Bella, the cantankerous Uncle Hec, and dog Tupac. When a tragedy strikes that threatens to ship Ricky to another home, both he and Hec go on the run in the bush. As a national manhunt ensues, the newly branded outlaws must face their options: go out in a blaze of glory or overcome their differences and survive as a family.  Equal parts road comedy and rousing adventure story, director Taika Waititi (WHAT WE DO IN THE SHADOWS, upcoming THOR: RAGNORAK) masterfully weaves lively humor with emotionally honest performances by Sam Neill and Julian Dennison....

Drama.title: I Can Only Imagine
Drama.description: The inspiring true story behind Christian band MercyMe's beloved, chart topping song that brings ultimate hope to so many with the power of true love and forgiveness.

Drama.title: I Kill Giants
Drama.description: A teen must face her fears in increasingly dangerous ways when horrible giants threaten to destroy her small town.

Drama.title: I Killed My BFF: The Preacher's Daughter
Drama.description: Inspired by true events, Lily Miller is the perfect preacher's daughter until wild child Rae Farwell meets and starts dating Lily's twin brother Jason.

Drama.title: I Love You Both
Drama.description: A pair of co-dependent twins (Doug Archibald and Kristin Archibald) are charmed by the same guy (Lucas Neff) at a party. When they both start dating him, they must figure out which of them he likes better without upsetting their brother-sister bond.

Drama.title: I Trapped the Devil
Drama.description: After trapping what he believes to be the devil, a man caught in a spiral of paranoia, trauma and evil unravels when his estranged family shows up for Christmas.

Drama.title: I'll Come Running
Drama.description: A young American woman finds herself drawn to a last-minute trip to Denmark, so that she can learn more about the man she loves.

Drama.title: I, Tonya
Drama.description: Based on the unbelievable but true events, I, Tonya is a dark comedic tale of American figure skater, Tonya Harding, and one of the most sensational scandals in sports history.

Drama.title: I.T.
Drama.description: Mike Regan (Pierce Brosnan) is a successful, self-made man. But he soon finds himself in a deadly game of cat-and-mouse when his I.T. consultant uses his skills to endanger Mike’s family, business and life.

Drama.title: If Beale Street Could Talk
Drama.description: Based on the novel by James Baldwin, "If Beale Street Could Talk" is a soulful drama about a young couple fighting for justice in the name of love and the promise of the American dream.

Drama.title: In a Relationship
Drama.description: Owen and Hallie have been together for years, but when Owen wavers on Hallie’s proposition to move in together, they make the rash decision to call it quits.

Drama.title: In the Fade
Drama.description: Katja’s husband and son are killed in a bomb attack. The mind numbing reasons behind the senseless act and eventual trial against the two suspects, a couple from the neo-Nazi scene, push Katja to the edge with no alternative but justice.

Drama.title: Innocent
Drama.description: Bill Pullman (Independence Day, Torchwood) stars as Rusty Sabich, a judge charged with the murder of his wife, a situation that comes 20 years after he was cleared in the death of his mistress.

Drama.title: Inside Out
Drama.description: After being released from prison after serving 13 years, AJ's dreams of living a crime-free life soon come to an end when he discovers his childhood friend, Jack, has been marked for death.

Drama.title: Instant Family
Drama.description: A couple who decides to start a family and adopt through the foster-care system, find themselves raising three wild kids who have no interest in being parented.

Drama.title: The Intended
Drama.description: A woman and her young lover arrive at a Malaysian ivory trading post, unleashing greed, murder and madness onto the outpost's inhabitants. This riveting drama stars Janet McTeer, Olympia Dukakis and Brenda Fricker.

Drama.title: Into the Ashes
Drama.description: After losing his wife, Nick must decide if he will stay on his new path or exact revenge and force his enemies to pay for what they have done.

Drama.title: Ismael's Ghosts
Drama.description: Twenty-one years ago, she ran away. And twenty-one years later, Carlotta (Marion Cotillard) is back from the void. But Ismael (Mathieu Amalric) has been busy rebuilding his life with Sylvia (Charlotte Gainsbourg) and working on his next feature film.

Drama.title: John Q
Drama.description: Denzel Washington stars as John Q, a man whose young son needs an emergency heart transplant. When he discovers his insurance won't cover it, he will do anything to keep his son alive.

Drama.title: Johnny Guitar
Drama.description: Gambling house operator Vienna seeks control of a town as archrival Emma Small sets out to force Vienna out of town. The timely arrival of Johnny Guitar thwarts Emma's plans, but doesn't prevent a showdown between the women.

Drama.title: Johnny Mad Dog
Drama.description: An African child soldier fights to rediscover his humanity.

Drama.title: Joshy
Drama.description: Joshy and his friends turn a getaway into a weekend of debauchery in this wickedly amusing portrayal of male bonding and emotional incompetence.

Drama.title: Juliet, Naked
Drama.description: Annie (the long-suffering girlfriend of Duncan) develops an unlikely transatlantic romance with the once admired, now washed up, singer-songwriter, Tucker Crowe, who also happens to be the subject of Duncan's musical obsession.

Drama.title: Just Charlie
Drama.description: Young soccer star Charlie has the world at his feet. With a top club desperate to sign him, his future is seemingly mapped out. But the teenager sees only a nightmare. Trapped in the body of a boy, Charlie is torn between wanting to live up to her father’s expectations and shedding this ill-fitting skin. Charlie’s next move will tear the family apart and threaten everything they hold dear.

Drama.title: The Kid
Drama.description: Vincent D'Onofrio directs this story of Rio, a young fan of Billy the Kid, who asks the fabled gunslinger to help him free his kidnappedsister, Sara, from his uncle's dastardly grip.

Drama.title: Killer Grandma
Drama.description: Melissa, a happily married woman with an eight-year-old daughter invites her husband's mother to live with them.

Drama.title: The Killer Next Door
Drama.description: After Julie's husband dies in a car crash, she moves across the country to start fresh with her son Matty and build a closer relationship with her late husband's twin sister, Alison. Little does she know, Alison blames Julie for her brother's death.

Drama.title: Kinsey
Drama.description: Liam Neeson stars in this critically acclaimed drama that details Professor Alfred Kinsey's groundbreaking work on human sexual behavior.

Drama.title: Knives and Skin
Drama.description: A small-town collapses into disarray after a teenage girl goes missing and her friends and their families become ensnared in a web of lies, suspicion, and depravity.

Drama.title: Lady in a Cage
Drama.description: When her home elevator breaks, trapping her inside, a sophisticated widow becomes a desperate prisoner of the cage like elevator and invading hoodlums

Drama.title: The Last Warrior
Drama.description: A 9.5-magnitude earthquake rocks Southern California, causing it to break off from the rest of the continent to form a desert island. The last warrior, Green Beret Nick Preston, leads a military patrol onto the devastated island to help the survivors.

Drama.title: The Last Word
Drama.description: Harriet is a retired businesswoman who tries to control everything around her. When she decides to write her own obituary, a young journalist takes up the task of finding out the truth, resulting in a life-altering friendship.

Drama.title: Leaving
Drama.description: Kristin Scott Thomas plays a married woman whose forbidden, adulterous affair with a handyman prompts her jealous husband to launch a revengeful campaign of blackmail.

Drama.title: Legendary
Drama.description: A book-smart teenager joins his school's wrestling team as a way to reunite his surviving family members, who split apart after the death of his father, a college wrestling legend, 10 years ago.

Drama.title: Lemon
Drama.description: Lemon: a person or thing that proves to be defective, imperfect, or unsatisfactory. Isaac Lachmann is a lemon. His career is going nowhere. His girlfriend of ten years is leaving him. Isaac Lachmann now just watches as his life unravels.

Drama.title: Let the Sunshine In
Drama.description: Juliette Binoche and Gerard Depardieu star in this charming romantic comedy about a woman looking for love in all the wrong places.

Drama.title: The Lincoln Lawyer
Drama.description: Michael "Mick" Haller, is a slick, charismatic Los Angeles criminal defense attorney who operates out of the back of his Lincoln Continental sedan.

Drama.title: Little Men
Drama.description: When 13-year-old Jake’s (Theo Taplitz) grandfather dies, his family moves from Manhattan back into his father’s Brooklyn home.

Drama.title: Little Richard
Drama.description: The story of the music icon's extraordinary life on stage and off - highlighted by original recordings of some of the most popular rock 'n' roll songs of all time.

Drama.title: Little Woods
Drama.description: Ollie (Tessa Thompson) is at the end of her probation after running prescription pills. But when her mother dies, she is thrust back into the life of her sister Deb (Lily James), who is contending with an unplanned pregnancy and a deadbeat ex.

Drama.title: Liz in September
Drama.description: Every year, Liz, a hardcore party girl and womanizer, celebrates her birthday with her friends at a Caribbean beach retreat. This year is different.

Drama.title: Lonely Man, The
Drama.description: A gunfighter turns rancher at the mercy of a son who hates him and a gambler who wants to kill him.

Drama.title: Looking for Eric
Drama.description: A British mailman gets relationship advice from soccer star Eric Cantona.

Drama.title: Lord of War
Drama.description: Oscar winner Nicolas Cage stars in this taut, action-packed tale of a notorious arms dealer who sold weapons to dictators and successfully outran the law for nearly twenty years.

Drama.title: Lords of Chaos
Drama.description: A teenager's quest to launch Norwegian Black Metal in Oslo in the early 1990s results in a very violent outcome.

Drama.title: Loro
Drama.description: Sex, drugs, power, and vice: the latest from Oscar(R)-winning director Paolo Sorrentino is a dazzling, audacious plunge into the scandalous world of Silvio Berlusconi.

Drama.title: Lost in London
Drama.description: A comedy that draws a new line between real and surreal, Woody Harrelson takes a live misadventure through London for an honest look at fame, family, and faith.

Drama.title: Love & Mercy
Drama.description: John Cusack and Paul Dano star as Beach Boys genius Brian Wilson in this film that intimately examines the unique journey and ultimate salvation of the musical icon.

Drama.title: Love After Love
Drama.description: Andie MacDowell shines as a mother exploring a new beginning while watching her sons' lives fall apart in this funny and inspiring drama.

Drama.title: The Lovers
Drama.description: After a dangerous dive into the wreckage of a British merchant ship to save his wife, a marine biologist falls into a coma that transports us back in time to India in 1788, where a young British captain falls for an Indian woman, in this tale of two centuries, two continents and star-crossed lovers linked together by a powerful ring. Stars Josh Hartnett.

Drama.title: Loving Vincent
Drama.description: Mystery surrounds the death of famed painter Vincent van Gogh in 1890 France.

Drama.title: Low Down
Drama.description: Jazz pianist Joe Albany (John Hawkes) and his daughter Amy-Jo (Elle Fanning) battle insurmountable odds in seedy 1970s Los Angeles in this compassionate and compelling story of the unwavering love between a father and a daughter.

Drama.title: Lowlife
Drama.description: The lives of a luchador, an ex-con and an addict collide when an organ harvesting scheme goes awry.

Drama.title: Luce
Drama.description: An all-star high school athlete and accomplished debater, Luce is a poster boy for the new American Dream. When Luce’s teacher makes a shocking discovery his stellar reputation is called into question.

Drama.title: Lucky (2017)
Drama.description: Having out lived and out smoked all of his contemporaries, the fiercely independent Lucky finds himself at the precipice of life, thrust into a journey of self-exploration, leading towards that which is so often unattainable: enlightenment

Drama.title: Ma Ma
Drama.description: Oscar-winner Penelope Cruz delivers the performance of her career as Magda, a woman who is determined to live life to the fullest in the face of her recent breast cancer diagnosis. In Spanish w/ English subtitles.

Drama.title: Mad to Be Normal
Drama.description: Scottish psychiatrist R.D. Laing performs various daring experiments on people who were diagnosed as mentally disturbed.

Drama.title: Madea's Big Happy Family
Drama.description: When Shirley receives distressing news about her health, it's up to her Aunt Madea to gather the clan and make things right the only way she knows how: with tough love and laughter.

Drama.title: Madonna and the Breakfast Club
Drama.description: The incredible untold story of pop icon Madonna’s struggling pre-fame years in New York City with her musician boyfriend, Dan Gilroy, and their first band Breakfast Club.

Drama.title: The Man Who Could Cheat Death
Drama.description: A man experimenting with immortality must have a gland operation every ten years to keep from reverting to his true age and dying a horrible death.

Drama.title: The Man Who Killed Hitler and Then the Bigfoot
Drama.description: An American war hero who secretly assassinated Adolf Hitler has now been called upon to take out another global threat – Bigfoot.

Drama.title: Manglehorn
Drama.description: Al Pacino and Holly Hunter give moving performances as a cat loving locksmith and a lovelorn bank teller who are both transformed by a new romance in this magical love story.

Drama.title: Mapplethorpe
Drama.description: A portrait of the celebrated yet controversial photographer Robert Mapplethorpe whose relationship with Patti Smith and other icons of the '70s New York influenced his photographs.

Drama.title: The March Sisters at Christmas
Drama.description: A modern retelling of Louisa May Alcott's "Little Women" follows four sisters who learn their mother plans on selling their home after the holidays. In an effort to keep the family together, the sisters try to restore the house.

Drama.title: Margarita with a Straw
Drama.description: A beautiful and personal story of a luminous Indian teenager (Kalki Koechlin) with cerebral palsy who leaves her homeland to study in New York, falls in love with a young blind woman, and begins a remarkable journey to self-discovery and independence.

Drama.title: Marguerite & Julien
Drama.description: Forbidden passion blazes between a brother and sister in this feverishly sexy romance.

Drama.title: Maze
Drama.description: Based on the incredible true story of the 1983 mass break-out of 38 IRA prisoners from the HMP Maze high security prison, one prisoner engineers the largest European prison escape since World War II.

Drama.title: Measure of a Man
Drama.description: A bullied teen experiences a turning point summer in which he learns to stand up for himself.

Drama.title: Meek's Cutoff
Drama.description: Set in 1845, this drama follows a group of settlers as they embark on a punishing journey along the Oregon Trail. When their guide leads them astray, the expedition is forced to contend with the unforgiving conditions of the high plain desert.

Drama.title: Meet Joe Black
Drama.description: Brad Pitt and Anthony Hopkins give stellar performances in this film about a powerful man who receives a visit from Death and agrees to serve as his earthly guide in exchange for more time.

Drama.title: Megan Leavey
Drama.description: MEGAN LEAVEY is based on the true life story of a young marine corporal (Kate Mara) whose unique discipline and bond with her military combat dog saved many lives during their deployment in Iraq. When she is assigned to clean up the K9 unit after a disciplinary hearing, Leavey identifies with a particularly aggressive dog, Rex, and is given the chance to train him. Over the course of their service, Megan and Rex completed more than 100 missions until an IED explosion injures them, putting their fate in jeopardy. Directed by Gabriela Cowperthwaite (BLACKFISH) from a screenplay by Pamela Gray and Annie Mumolo & Tim Lovestedt, the film also stars Edie Falco, Ramón Rodríguez, Bradley Whitford, and Common.

Drama.title: The Men Who Stare at Goats
Drama.description: In this quirky dark comedy inspired by a real-life story, astonishing revelations about a top-secret wing of the U.S. military come to light when a reporter encounters an enigmatic Special Forces operator on a mind-boggling mission.

Drama.title: A Mermaid's Tale
Drama.description: Twelve-year-old Ryan is despondent about moving to a dying seacoast village until she forms an unlikely friendship with a quirky teenage mermaid.

Drama.title: The Messenger
Drama.description: Will, an Iraq War veteran, struggles with his new post at the Casualty Notification Office. Under mentorship of fellow officer, Tony, the two men form a bond that will ultimately help them to readjust to "normal" life.

Drama.title: Middle Men
Drama.description: Businessman Jack Harris had the perfect life - a beautiful family and a successful career fixing problem companies. When Jack agrees to help steer two entrepreneurs business, he soon finds himself caught between a 23-year-old porn star and the FBI.

Drama.title: Middle of Nowhere
Drama.description: A restless troublemaking teenager falls for a tightly wound co-worker as they team up to earn big money and escape their families.

Drama.title: The Miracle Season
Drama.description: Based on the inspiring true story of West High girls' volleyball team. After the loss of the their star player, Caroline "Line" Found, in an accident, the remaining team players must band together in hopes of winning the state championship.

Drama.title: Moll Flanders
